113.content:
It was another ordinary day in Ponyville. Twilight Sparkle was in her home at the library, practicing a special spell she had been working with in her room. Suddenly, she saw a flash of green appear out of the corner of her eye from under the door, accompanied by a fiery sounding belch, and she recognized what it was instantly. Spike, her baby dragon assistant, had received another letter from Princess Celestia. She stopped her spell and opened the door to let Spike in. He was in the process of looking over the letter as Twilight walked over to join him. She looked over his shoulder at the letter. She felt this was unusual, since Princess Celestia never sent a letter to her out of the blue like this unless it was an emergency or something important.

"What does it say?" Twilight asked her young assistant, "I hope it's not bad news."

"It doesn't seem like it, " said Spike, as he read the letter out loud:

"Dear Twilight Sparkle,

Do not worry. I have written to you because I would like for you to visit me at Canterlot. It's been a while since you have been here last, and I would like to catch up on old times and discuss what all you've been learning about magic and friendship. Perhaps you could show me that spell you were working on that you told me about in that letter you sent with your latest friendship report. I hope you will stop by soon.

May the sun's blessing be with you, my faithful student.

Sincerely,
Princess Celestia"


Twilight let out a sigh of relief. "Whew! I'm glad it's nothing major to worry about. Besides, I can't wait to show her what I've been working on."

"That reminds me," said Spike, "What WAS that spell you were working with?"

"Well, I guess it's no use hiding it from you, my number one assistant," Twilight responded, "The spell I'm working with is able to..."
113.title: Twilight was sent to visit Celestia

choices: Uh-oh, got her TOO young (Newborn/ Past Birth)
1131.content:
"...change a pony's age. It can make anypony younger or older. I honestly can't help but wonder what Celestia was like when she was very little, so maybe I could be allowed to try it out on her."

"That does sound interesting. I kind of want to see it for myself," Spike said.

"I'm sure you would, Spike," said Twilight to her young assistant.

A FEW DAYS LATER...

After traveling up to Canterlot and getting permission from the guards, Twilight made her way to Celestia's chambers. When she met up with the princess, they began to discus various matters, like some of Twilight's adventures that she didn't usually mention in her friendship reports, as well as some of what Celestia's royal duties had in store for her. Eventually, they got around to spells and magic that Twilight had been working with.

"So, would you care to show me the new spell you have been working with?" Celestia asked her student.

"Oh, right, that one. Before I do that, though, may I ask you something?"

"Go ahead."

"Have you ever missed being little?"

At that, the princess thought it over. Come to think of it, she had been thinking about her fillyhood a lot lately ever since she reunited with her sister Luna. She remembered playing with her little sister in the days before they both had to take responsibility for controlling the sun and the moon, and she had missed such carefree times.

"Well, I guess, somewhat. Why do you ask, my faithful student?"

"Because this new spell has the ability to alter age. I used some test subjects before I got here and the results were, needless to say, rather successful."

-------

Applejack and Big Macintosh could hardly believe what they saw. What was once their Granny Smith was now a cheerful and energetic young filly with a light caramel brown mane hopping around what was once their little sister Apple Bloom, now an elderly mare with a faded red mane, a bow in her hair, and, much to the former filly's dismay, a blank flank. And no one seemed to know what happened to them. After watching this scene, Applejack and Big Macintosh turned to look at each other, both of them still in shock. "Big Mac?"

"Yeah?"

"I want ya ta hit me right 'n th' face, as hard as ya can. No buckin', though."

Without a word, Big Mac slowly raised his front hoof in preparation for the strike.

-------

"Well, that's good to know. I suppose you could try it on me."

"Are you sure?"

"You used to use me as a test subject for a few of your spells, you remember that, Twilight. Needless to say, they were all minor spells, but I'm sure I can handle something like this, if I can still get back to normal."

"All right, whatever you say."

Twilight and Celestia stood up and faced each other. Twilight charged the magical energy in her horn and concentrated on the spell. This will make her younger, thought Twilight, no need for her to be older.

"Are you ready?" Celestia asked.

"Yes I am," said Twilight, before unleashing her magic upon the princess, regressing to the point where she became a...

11313.content:
Twilight felt she had made a major mistake with that spell. Not only had she forgot to ask how young Celestia wanted to be, but she had concentrated too hard to conjure up the rejuvenating energy, and she feared it would be too much for the princess to handle. What she saw, however, had confirmed that fear. After getting knocked backward by the burst of energy, Celestia began to shrink and progressively descend in age, and it seemed to be out of control.

"Princess, I'm so sorry! I must have used too much power!" Twilight said before running up to her. At that point, Celestia had regressed until she was about Twilight's age, but she still had her magnificent multi-colored mane and her crown and jewelry were still managing to hold up a little bit.

Celestia calmly spoke, her voice somewhat higher in pitch, "It's alright, Twilight. It was most likely my fault. I was so excited by this spell that I forgot to tell how young I wanted to be. I'll just have to wait and accept what I become by the time the effects have stopped." By that point, she had regressed down to filly age, a little older than the Cutie Mark Crusaders, and her crown and jewelry had fallen off, as she looked up to Twilight.

"What? No. NO, PRINCESS CELESTIA! Don't give into this! I know how to fix this. Please, just let me get the spell ready and I'll have you back to normal!"

The princess said nothing, however, as she was now a baby foal with the inability to speak. Soon, her legs began to shake, and she found it hard to stand. Eventually, she couldn't hold herself up any longer and fell onto her belly. Twilight gasped at this. Usually, pony foals could stand up and walk not very long after birth. When Twilight saw Celestia fall down, she figured she had regressed down to a foal that had only just been born. Fortunately, the effects must have ended, since she had stopped regressing at this point.

Twilight levitated the baby princess into the air with her magic. She held out her hooves and managed to get a hold of Celestia. Twilight stared at Celestia and Celestia stared at her in return, and Twilight couldn't believe all this. Princess Celestia, her teacher, one of the rulers of the land, one of the most powerful magic users, and regent of the sun, was now nothing more than a tiny baby filly not even old enough to walk and currently being held by her student. Twilight brought her closer and hugged Celestia to her chest. She felt the urge to cry about this, but hopefully the spell had ended so that she would be able to try and get her back to normal then. But had the spell's effects finished?

Thankfully, the transformation stopped there. Twilight looked down at the tiny foal Celestia in her arms. It looked like she had just been born. The rainbow colored mane she had was shorter and not flowing, her legs were thin and lanky, and her wings and horn were tiny. "Well," sighed Twilight, "at least it didn't get any worse."

She set the foal down in front of her, and they both laid there staring at each other. Not too long after that, Celestia decided to stand up. She got up, but felt pretty weak in the legs as they shook and wobbled. In spite of what had occurred, Twilight found this to be adorable. When the baby princess made her way over to Twilight, she reached up as best as she could... and then licked Twilight on the nose. Twilight was startled by this action, but it felt good to her. Celestia backed up a little bit, and Twilight figured she should ask her and see how she reacts.

Celestia shook her head.

Twilight could ask about what to do about this, but first she wanted to see if Celestia remembered. So she asked, "Do you remember who you are?"

As Twilight was holding the newly regressed baby Celestia against her, she was thinking about how she would get her back to normal. Suddenly, as she was holding her, the baby princess vanished into thin air. Twilight was immediately alerted at this, and stood up and started to look around the room, when just then, she felt an odd sensation in her stomach. It felt like several extra pounds was added onto her at once, as her legs wobbled and she tried to regain her footing. And as soon as the feeling had started, it stopped, and she was able to stand up well enough. Twilight was beginning to question what happened when she suddenly looked down at herself and got her answer.

Her belly was now large and rounded and she could feel something inside.

Twilight started to think over how this was possible. Surely it wasn't something she ate. Nothing could have automatically cause her to gain such weight all at once in a short amount of time. Besides, this didn't feel ANYTHING like a full stomach. At that point, she came to a conclusion that, quite frankly, creeped her out: "I'm pregnant with Princess Celestia," Twilight said quietly to herself, with a look of horrific realization on her face. Before she had time to react, however, she suddenly became overwhelmed with fatigue. Quickly, she climbed up onto the princess' bed in order to rest her body. She looked down at her pregnant belly, knowing that one of the regal sisters was lurking in there, now a tiny foal awaiting birth. This is really getting weird, Twilight thought to herself. As she thought of what to do, however...

1131321.title: Someone came in on her

1131322.content:
"Twilight..."

"Huh?" Twilight looked around. She thought she heard something. And she did. A small voice.

"Twilight Sparkle..." the voice said again.

Twilight felt this voice sounded... unique. Beautiful, but unique. It sounded like a filly that was just learning to speak, it was high pitched and youthful, but it also had a mystical aspect to it and it sounded mature and wise beyond its years.

"Twilight. It's me, Celestia. I'm telepathically communicating with you. I taught you how to do it once. Do you remember how?"

"Yes," said Twilight, now communicating telepathically with her teacher. "You ARE the foal that's inside me, aren't you?"

“Indeed, I am,” Celestia responded.

“But how are you communicating with me? Shouldn't you have lost your magic when you became a baby again?”

“Your regression spell DID take away most of my magic. However, I still have a little bit left, like the ability to communicate with you through telepathy.”

“Oh, Princess Celestia, I’m so sorry you had to wind up like this.”

“Think nothing of it, my faithful student. It’s very nice and comforting to be back in the safety of the womb and curled in a fetal position, although it does feel kind of cramped in here.” Soon afterwards, Twilight felt something against the side of her belly. She looked down and saw that the foal was kicking from inside the womb. She could even see the little hooves of Celestia pushing up against Twilight’s exposed stomach from the inside.

“Celestia, he he he, please stop it,” Twilight said, gently giggling at the unusual feeling of experiencing what an expectant mother feels like before rubbing her hoof against her belly and trying to feel around for the foal that was in there. She could hear giggling.

“He-he-hey-y-y! C-cut that out! It ti-tickles! He he he he!”

“I’m serious, we need to get you out soon and then restore you to normal. I-I’ll even give birth to you, if I have to,” Twilight said, telepathically, although she couldn’t believe she actually thought that last part.

"No need to worry. We can still communicate while I'm in here. In fact, I want to tell a few secrets that I feel you should know, and I figure this is the perfect way, through telepathic secrecy. I've told most of these to no one else but my sister, and some of them SHE doesn't even know about. Since you are my personal student, as well as one of the only true friends I've ever had in a thousand years, I feel that I can share these with you."

"Well, why'd you wait for now to tell me? You could have telepathically communicated with me any time."

"True, but I felt like using this opportunity to get really close and personal to you."

"That's fine, but I didn't mean LITERALLY LIKE THIS! Not 'close and personal' as in 'inside my belly, tiny, helpless, and attached to an umbilical cord'"

"I'm sorry about all that, but try to feel at ease now."

Twilight did so, and laid on her side as she looked over to her belly, which now held one of the princesses inside.

"Okay."

"Now, Twilight, I think it's time that I tell you this..."

What will one of her secrets be?
1131322.title: She heard a small voice

choices: Continue conversing and discussing about this revelation with Celestia
Call Celestia out for her cowardice of hiding from her duties
11313221.content:
"...I hate being a princess."

"WHAT?!!?" Twilight was shocked by this revelation.

"I mean, I loved it at first, being in charge of a country, having control over the sun, being waited on, all that power was nice for a while. But over the years, especially during Luna's absence, I've grown to hate it with a passion, but I've kept my feelings inside me. I hate how everyone kisses up to me, I hate those mindless drones devoid of emotion known as 'guards', but most of all, I HATE how my reputation of being this powerful being that vanquished evil has affected everyone. Every time I want to do a social visit, I'm expected to allow EVERYONE to wait on me. Remember that party at the Cakes when I visited once?"

"Yes, you tricked the Cakes into overfilling your cup when they kept giving you refills."

"Exactly. All the ponies tend to be so overworked about me, thinking I should be treated like a god, but inside, I want to be looked at as being a normal, fun-loving pony who feels that everyone around me should just loosen up. That's why I enjoyed the Grand Galloping Gala that you and your friends attended, because they actually brought some life to that dull affair. But even after I've shown this aspect of me, you still see me as the same old 'Ms. High & Mighty Princess Celestia' that has ruled since before Discord's reign of terror* and my sister becoming Nightmare Moon and all that."

"I guess that's true."

"However, I had not let this hatred consume me until one faithful day, when you were late with the friendship report. I was upset at you, but I was mostly upset with myself. While your obsessive compulsive behavior and your use of that spell were to blame, what was also a factor was the fear that seems to surround me. The fear that, if you didn't do something or did something incorrectly, that you would be punished immensely for it. But what you don't understand is that I'm not like that most of the time. When I heard that you were worried about being sent back to Magic Kindergarden for not turning the report in, that was the straw that broke this pony's back. I had not been showing it, but I have grown to hate myself IMMENSELY for causing others to worry about the 'wrath' that I would bring down upon them. My reputation had gotten too good for me. But I don't have to worry about it now. I'm safe inside you, without any royal duties or meetings or raising the sun or anything to deal with."

As Twilight was telepathically listening to her teacher in the womb, she was thinking about how to respond to this...



*I personally hate how people automatically assume that Discord was the former ruler of Equestria, since the writers had left it incredibly vague as to what they meant when he "ruled Equestria in a state of unrest and unhappiness", and he just comes off more as an incredibly powerful trickster and troublemaker rather than a vengeful former ruler. Plus, I can't picture Celestia and Luna as being "usurpers" at all, so the idea of him being the legitimate former ruler of Equestria is bullcrap. Personally, I think Celestia and Luna had always ruled, but they weren't able to stop Discord when he invaded Equestria until they had the Elements Of Harmony. Wanna argue with me about it? Here and now is NOT the place.

choices: ...someone else joined them. Princess Luna's been eavesdropping telepathically!
...Twilight suddenly felt strange. Absorbing Celestia's magic is changing her!
113132212.content:
As Twilight pondered what her mentor had just told her, she felt a variety of emotions. Happiness that Celestia cared so much for her subjects. Sadness that Celestia was suffering. Guilt at having caused Celestia suffering. Bewilderment that Celestia hated being a princess. But one emotion became more and more prominent the more she thought about it, and it was that emotion that she gave voice to. "So, you're just going to run and hide from your duties? I'm disappointed in you, Princess."

         She could almost feel Celestia blink inside her. "Huh?" the fetal Princess asked, confused.

         "You heard me. I'm disappointed. I knew you were many things, Princess, but I never even considered ever calling you a coward."

         "C-coward?!" Celestia exclaimed. She had never heard Twilight talk to her like this before.

         "Yes, a coward. You're just running away by hiding in me. You don't seem to get something, that maybe if you just asked everypony to treat you differently, that they might. You're telling me all of this because you think it's safe. Well, it's not! Your disappearance is going to be noticed. You think how people react normally around you is bad? Just picture what people are going to do when they realize you're gone! Think of your sister! Think of the rest of Equestria! Your disappearance is going to cause a panic the likes of which the world's never seen before! And your first reaction to what's happened is, 'I'm glad I can hide away in my student'?! Which, by the way, is very creepy for me. I'm your student, not your mother!"

         Celestia was in shock. Twilight had just scolded her. And what was more, as Celestia thought about it, the younger unicorn was right. She may have hated being a princess, but she was still someone that everypony looked up to. She was an inspiration to the common folk. She had certainly inspired Twilight, if what the unicorn had told her of her Cutie Mark was true. As Celestia thought about this, guilt welled up in her. Here she was, saying how much she hated being a princess, when the rest of Equestria looked to her as a leadership figure. She was needed. That much was plain. "Twilight...I'm sorry. You're completely right. I've hated my status, but my hatred has blinded me to the good things that I have in life. My sister, my wealth, my looks...and my beloved student. I burdened you with this secret, and you told me what a fool I've been. That must have been hard for you, but all I could think about was how happy I'd be if I didn't have to put up with being a princess anymore. I'm so sorry! I'm a terrible mentor!" The princess was tearing up from the guilt she felt.

         Twilight's expression softened as she heard the princess's reply, and she nuzzled the bulge in her stomach. "No, you're not, Princess. You've been a great mentor to me. I just wanted to remind you that as much as you might hate your job, someone has to do it. I'm certainly not capable of lifting the sun into the sky!"

         Celestia chuckled a little, drying her tears as best she could in the unicorn's womb. "I should hope not! If you were capable of that, I'd have to keep you here in Canterlot so I could take a vacation now and then!"

         The two laughed at the silliness of the idea, albeit for different reasons: Twilight at the idea of Celestia taking a vacation, Celestia at the idea of keeping Twilight away from her friends. Before the two of them could continue their conversation...
113132212.title: Calling the Princess out

choices: She explains the situation straight out. No point in dishonesty among friends.
The choice is taken from her when she goes into labor!
1131322121.content:
"You really should learn to keep your minds closed when chatting like this," came another voice, that caused Twilight and Celestia to jump in surprise. The sensation of a jumping fetus inside her was...uncomfortable for Twilight, and she very nearly lost her lunch. "Were we anypony else, we might have used the knowledge of this conversation to cause problems throughout Equestria. Be grateful that we sensed the magic from your de-aging spell, Twilight Sparkle."

         "L-Luna?!" exclaimed Celestia. "How did you...?"

         "You are a kind-hearted pony, sister, thus you tend to ignore the darker aspects magic can be used for...such as eavesdropping. Admittedly, it's not as heinous as other things, but magical eavesdropping has been a study of ours. How else are we to ensure your safety if you're alone with some no-name stallion?" The telepathic voice of Princess Luna held a small degree of mirth at this, while Twilight blushed at the implications. As if some 'no-name stallion' would ever try something with Princess Celestia!

         "Um...Princess Luna, how much did you overhear?" the young unicorn asked.

         "Enough to understand that until further notice, our sister will be...incapacitated. However, in the meantime, we will take over affairs here in Canterlot, as well as the rising of the sun." Despite the confidence in her words, both Twilight and Celestia could tell there was some nervousness in the younger princess at the concept.

         "Luna, are you certain? I mean, I only took over the rising of the moon out of necessity." Celestia appreciated the offer, deep in her heart, but she was worried that her sister might not be up to the task of raising both heavenly orbs.

         "And you say that it is not a necessity in this case? Unless you plan on being restored later this afternoon, we believe this to be a matter of prudence." Twilight idly noted that Luna's tone, while somewhat haughty, was nonetheless better than her visit to Ponyville's Nightmare Night not too long ago. Still there was a small hint of anxiety in the younger princess's voice.

         "Princess Luna, forgive me for asking, but...when was the last time you attended a social function here in Canterlot?" A few moment's silence was all the answer she needed. "Princess, I've seen you in passing only a few times during my visits here, but even the guards seem nervous around you. Do you really think that you can manage the social affairs here in Canterlot without some assistance?"

         "Twilight raises a good point, Luna. The nobles won't accept you stepping up to take charge with no explanation, even if you are a princess. You never were the most...sociable of ponies, even before you strayed into darkness. You've been even less so since your return."

         The two 'heard' Luna sigh. "We will explain that you are recovering from a misfired spell, that your student is helping in your recovery, and that until you've recovered, we will handle the affairs of Equestria. In the meantime, Twilight Sparkle, you should return to Ponyville, and keep as low a profile as you can. We do not want word of this situation getting out of hand."

         Twilight and Celestia considered this. Celestia knew that the nobles wouldn't press the issue too much with such an explanation. After all, Twilight was well-known, having saved Equestria from Discord's influence. The unicorn herself, however, had some misgivings. "There's no way I'm going to be able to keep this a secret from my friends. And how am I supposed to hide this in town?"

         "We would hope that someone as powerful in magic as you, Twilight Sparkle, would know a simple glamour spell," Luna deadpanned. Twilight face-hoofed at that.

         "Ah, right. Heh. Almost forgot my own talents. This whole situation's really taking it out of me. But that doesn't help in regard to my friends."

         "I believe it will be safe to explain the situation to them. They are your fellow Elements of Harmony, after all. If you try to hide something like this from them, they would be most upset when they eventually found out. As you said, you won't be able to keep it a secret from them." Celestia was being reassuring, but in truth, she wondered if the other five Elements would truly understand the situation at all.

         Still, it seemed to reassure Twilight. "Alright, then...I guess we'll leave Canterlot in your hooves, Princess Luna. I'd better get back to Ponyville." With that, she focused her magic, casting a glamour on herself to hide her current predicament. She then began making her way through Canterlot back to Ponyville, stopping only to pick up Spike, who she'd dropped off at her old library in Canterlot.

***


         Arriving back in Ponyville, Twilight made her way to the library as quickly as she could. She had deflected all of Spike's questions regarding her visit with Celestia, and it was beginning to get tiring. She got to the library and opened the door while declining, yet again, to answer. "For the last time, Spike, I'd rather not say anything about -"

         "Gotcha!" said a brash voice that Twilight had enough time to register as Rainbow Dash's when said cyan pegasus fairly dragged her and Spike into the library, slamming the door behind them. Looking around, Twilight noticed all five of her pony friends were present. Rainbow was smirking, for some odd reason. "So, what's so big that Princess LUNA sent us a message to meet you here, in secret, with nopony else around?"

         For a moment, Twilight stared blankly. Then she sighed. "Your sister is evil, and I don't mean in the Nightmare Moon way." Hearing Celestia's mental giggle, Twilight began speaking out loud. "Are you asking for the specifics, or why Princess Luna sent it, rather than Princess Celestia?"

         "Both," came the collective reply, before Applejack added, "Was a bit of a shock to see a black-sealed letter appear in front of mah face, Twilight."

         Sighing, Twilight debated what the best way to approach this would be...
1131322121.title: Luna's Solution

choices: they take what they've been told quite well and are understanding
they're freaking out over the situation
11313221211.content:
Twilight sighed. While she knew she had to tell her friends about what happened, but she had at lest hoped for some time before speaking with them so she could plan out what she was going to tell them, but thanks to Princesses Luna, it looks like now rather then later.

“Okay, everypony, it’s like this… I was over at Canterlot to show Princess Celestia a new age reversal spell I’ve been working on.” the purple unicorn began, looking round the room at each of her friends, worried about how they would react when she told them, “I- I used the spell on the Princess after asking her if she ever felt like reliving her fillyhood days, but I made a mistake and the spell made the princess too young, then she kept getting younger and younger until she became younger then a newborn and then…well…” biting her lower lip, Twilight undid the glamour spell, revealing her condition to her friends.

At once the five ponies gasped in shock.

“Twilight, are you…?” Rarity asked.

The purple unicorn nodded, sliding down to a sitting position on the floor and told them the rest of the story,

“and then Luna came in, having listening in on what happened, and agreed to help by covering for Princess Celestia’s disappearance and taking care of her duties until we can return her to normal.”

Taking a deep breath, Twilight looked to her friends to see…
11313221211.title: No point in dishonesty among friends.

113132212111.content:
"Sugarcube, this is...mighty odd, ta say the least," Applejack started. "But, we're yer friends, and we'll help ya and Princess Celestia any way we possibly can."

         The others all nodded. Twilight felt a huge sense of relief on seing that. "Thank you, everypony. It means a lot to me to have your support."

         "Wait 'till everypony else hears about this!" exclaimed Pinkie Pie, bouncing on her legs. "I've got to start making plans for the party and -"

         She was cut off as her head was seized in a magical grip, and she was yanked down to look into Twilight's rather upset eyes. "NOPONY besides us is to know about this. That means no parties." Seeing Pinkie about to protest, she elaborated. "Princess Luna told me to keep a low profile. Having a party is the exact opposite of that." She glanced around. "I want ALL of you, even YOU, Spike," she addressed the dragon who had simply been gawking at Twilight up until this point, "to Pinkie Pie Promise not to breathe a word of this to anypony until we can fix Princess Celestia."

         "But of course, Twilight!" Rarity agreed. "I mean, can you imagine the uproar that would be caused if somepony found out that Princess Celestia got her own student pregnant?" She blinked, then blushed heavily. "That...sounded a lot less kinky in my head."

         Twilight was fighting back her own blush. "No kiddng," she muttered. The sentiment was echoed by Celestia. "A-anyways, I don't know how long it'll be before...I give birth," her blush deepened, "so I'm going to stay here in the library until further notice. Anypony asks, I'm sick with a bad case of Horn Pox."

         While Rarity nodded, the others all blinked. "Horn Pox?" Rainbow Dash asked, quirking an eyebrow. "Is that anything like Wing Pox?"

         Twilight blinked. "Depends. Is Wing Pox generally harmless to fillies and colts, but more dangerous to older mares and stallions?" Seeing Rainbow nod, Twilight gave a nod of her own. "In a unicorn my age, Horn Pox can be crippling, possibly even fatal. Other unicorns probably won't question it."

         "While it's a nice cover, Twi, what're ya gonna do if somepony wants to see ya?" Level-headed Applejack was thinking of the possible consequences of the scenario.

         "If somepony wants to see me, they'll have to speak to Rarity, who is going to be my 'caretaker' while I've got the 'Horn Pox'." As Rarity gave Twilight a startled look, the mage elaborated. "It makes more sense for a unicorn to take care of another unicorn with Horn Pox, rather than a pegasus or earth pony."

         "Ah. True enough, I suppose..." Rarity nodded.

         "By the way, I still haven't heard you all Pinkie Pie Promise that you won't let word of this get out," Twilight reminded them pointedly. Rainbow and Applejack rolled their eyes, but complied.

         "Cross my heart, hope to fly, stick a cupcake in my eye," everypony (and Spike) said, doing the motions as well.

         When they were done, Fluttershy spoke up for the first time. "Twilight, what are you going to do when you actually...give birth?" She blushed a little saying that.

         "I'm actually hoping it won't get to that point," Twilight said, using her magic to levitate some tomes over to her. "With any luck, I'll find a spell I can use to reverse this without having to go through that. Because, while I admit to being close to Princess Celestia, I never wanted to be THIS close!"
113132212111.title: True Friends Always Understand

When Twilight was laughing with Celestia, her body began to hurt, and not in her stomach, but everywhere else. "W...wha...what's happ.. ppen..inggg?" stuttered Twilight as her body began to reform and reshape in a painful manner.

"TWILIGHT! Are you ok!?" replied the fetal princess. Just as she said that, the transformation completed with a loud popping noise and in the place where Twilight laid was a purple alicorn, semi-conscious of what just happened.

"Twilight! Twilight!" shouted Celestia telepathically.

"What just happened?" asked the newly-transformed alicorn telepathically, with her eyes closed in pain.

"Twilight, is something wrong?" said Princess Celestia, concerned.

"I feel fine, but for some reason, different as well," replied Twilight, standing up and looking down at herself.

"Twilight, I feel less cramped for some reason. Did you use magic or something?" Celestia asked, in amazement of her new free space. She stretched her legs out a little more and though her foot still reached the wall of the uterus and allowed her to kick at it, she wasn't as close to it as before.

"No, not really. I actually..." Twilight paused to see her new alicorn wings and size. She turned to the full-body mirror, and stared face to face with a purple alicorn that looked exactly like her.

"WHAT IN THE HAY HAPPENED TO ME?!!?" screamed Twilight out loud.

"Twilight?"

"Oh, sorry, Celestia," Twilight said, resuming her telepathy and lying back down on the bed, "I just discovered that... I turned into an alicorn."

"WHAT?" Celestia asked in shock.

"It's shocking, I know, but I didn't cast anything on myself. It just happened."

"Oh, thank goodness. I thought I had regressed backwards a month or two," Celestia sighed in relief.

"But that still leaves us with the question of how I turned into an alicorn," Twilight said.

113132221.content:
"...I've always wanted to be young again."

"Huh?" Twilight was somewhat startled by this.

"Remember how you asked me if I ever missed being little? Well, your assumption was correct. Ever since Luna came back, I have been thinking a lot about our fillyhood, long before we were given control over Equestria and the sun and the moon, when she and I used to play together, by ourselves and with our own little group of friends. We even went out on adventures and learned about friendship all the time. Whenever I get your friendship reports, I reminisce back to those wonderful times."

"Really?"

"Yep, but I've always had this desire, especially when Luna was imprisoned those thousand years on the moon. I had awaited her return so when things got to normal, we could find a way to relieve those good old days. Sadly, we're the only ones left among our original group of friends."

"I'm sorry to hear that, but how does this involve me?"

"Well, not only have I had fond memories lately, but I've also had dreams about Luna and I being little again, and there's even one where... you are our mother."

"WHAT?!?"

"It sounds unusual, but it's true. I did have a dream where you, my faithful student, were our mother. In it, Luna and I were just baby foals, and you would feed us, play with us, read to us, and you would even show us to your friends. I could imagine how each of them reacted to us."

"Wow, I had no idea..."

"I personally adored this dream. Perhaps if Luna joined us, then this dream could be reality."

"I hate to break this to you, Princess, but there are several factors you don't seem to realize. First and formost, who would rule the land, as well as the sun and the moon, while you two were little? Second, wouldn't this be against Luna's will? Third, I've never had any real experience looking after children, foalsitting or otherwise! Fourth, what about my own studies? It'll be hard when I have two fillies to look after. Fifth, how long do you intend to be in this state? And while I like this idea myself, I just don't know if it'll work out like you think it will."

Everything went silent, then. Twilight wondered what had happened with Celestia, so she used some see-through magic to see what was going on inside of her, which was what ponies in Equestria used instead of ultrasounds. Inside, Princess Celestia had closed her eyes and she was sucking on her right hoof. She appeared to be asleep, so Twilight turned off the spell and lightly poked at her stomach, as she telepathically heard the youthful-sounding voice of her mentor once again.

"Uh... Wha? Oh, Twilight. Sorry about that. I was deep in thought over what to do about this, and I must have dozed off while doing so."

"And were you able to think of something?" Twilight responded.

What was Celestia's response?

11313222111.content:
"We'll use Alternate Reality Magic to bring this dream reality to life and see how this would play out, while we observe from outside it."

"Can you possibly do that? I mean, most of your magic is gone, isn't it?"

"That's true, but maybe we could activate it through touching both of our horns together and combining our magic."

"What? But how will I know when my horn is touching yours? You're still inside of me."

"Hold on," said Celestia, telepathically. At that moment, a patch of white light appeared on Twilight's belly, and it seemed to be coming from underneath her skin. "See that light?"

"Yes."

"That's where my horn is. Touch it with yours, now."

"Okay." said Twilight, telepathically. With a little effort, she was able to lower her horn onto the spot of light. It began to glow as well as she heard Celestia's telepathic voice again.

"Show us a reality of the dream where the unicorn, Twilight Sparkle, is the mother of Luna and I."

Suddenly, things began to distort around them as the room turned into a smear of color and stretched out into the distance. Soon Twilight could feel herself being dragged towards it at lightning speed, and in a flash of light, Twilight woke up to find herself in a dark and empty room. She looked down and noticed her belly was now flat. Realizing what happened, Twilight quickly galloped around the room for a bit trying to find where Celestia was, before coming across an unusual sight. It was a white pony fetus, still in the womb, with a pink and green mane and tail and a small horn and wings. It was curled up, its eyes were closed, and it had an umbilical cord attached to it. The womb was floating in the air and glowing, so it created some light in the dark room. The fetus then opened its eyes and looked at Twilight, as the unicorn heard the same telepathic voice speak to her.

"Hello, Twilight. You can speak to me regularly here if you like. I myself cannot talk normally however, due to my motor functions not being developed enough yet, so I'll have to keep speaking to you like this."

"Ok." said Twilight. Not that she didn't like speaking telepathically, but it was kind of wearing on her. "Is this you, Celestia?"

"Yes, it is."

"Wow, you're so tiny." As Twilight quietly said this, she used her magic to bring the prenatal princess closer to her. She sat down and put her hooves around the floating fetus, as she stared in awe at it. She gently poked at Celestia's belly, and giggled as she saw her react a little bit to the touch.

"Just be careful with me now."

"Alright," said Twilight, and she looked across the room, "but where are we? Aren't we supposed to be in an alternate reality?"

"We are, but we're not in the actual reality itself. As I mentioned, we'll be observing it through a window that shows this new reality as it is happening." As Celestia spoke this, a square, white area opened up nearby. It was incredibly bright, but an image was forming within. Twilight galloped over to this window and Celestia floated over by her, as they both looked into the window to see this new reality that had been formed from Celestia's dream.

What do they see?

113132221112.content:
As Twilight and the unborn Princess Celestia moved toward the window, they noticed a shocking sight of an emergency pony hospital room, where on a low bed lay a pregnant Twilight about to give birth to the two royal newborn foals. There were 2 adult pony doctors at Twilight's side preparing her for the delivery.

"This is very shocking," said Twilight, "and it does look like it would hurt." As she looked back and forth to her birth-giving self in the window and to the unborn royal fetus of Princess Celestia next to her.

Princess Celestia telepathically replied, "Relax, my faithful student. This is a natural procedure all mother ponies go through. It is a scene known as the Miracle of Birth."

"I do notice how it is a sight to see, but how can I handle this myself?" asked Twilight, with a surprised and worried tone.

They both stopped and watched as they saw the birth-giving Twilight scream when the first princess foal began to come outside the womb. "Calm down, Miss Twilight, the first baby foal is just making its way out," said the first doctor holding the horn of the emerging infant. The head started to emerge, and with one final push, out she came.

Just as the foal Celestia had been born, she began to cry. The second doctor cut the umbillical cord, and the first doctor gave the baby foal to the still birth-giving Twilight, placing Celestia right next to her. Celestia's crying stopped when she felt Twilight's warmth. "It's a filly," the first doctor announced.

Both Twilights were at awe when the new born Celestia began to suck her right hoof. The Twilight in the window began to gently lick her new foal, as a way of affection. "Miss Twilight, are you ready for the next child?" asked the first doctor.

"Yes, I am ready," replied Twilight, preparing to give birth to the second child.

As the second foal known as Luna began to emerge, the observing Princess Celestia and Twilight were in awe at the baby foal Celestia with her eyes still closed and her mouth sucking on her little hoof. The fetal Celestia began to say telepathically, "This is a magical moment indeed. I've never personally got much of a chance to see this for myself in over one thousand years!"

"I notice why mothers are always so happy to see their newborns even if there is more than one," said Twilight, looking back and forth at the fetal princess next to her and the newly born princess in the dream world.

Both Princess Celestia and Twilight stared as the second foal began to escape the womb of the other Twilight. While the first doctor got the second foal out, the second one cut the umbillical cord, and once that was over, they placed her by her sister. "They're fraternal twin fillies," the first doctor told Twilight.

Twilight looked down at the new born foals with tears in her eyes, "They're so beautiful..." Even though she was worn out from this procedure, she nuzzled both Celestia and Luna as they were lying by her side. The two newborn sisters began to snuggle up against Twilight.

"This is the most beautiful sight to all ponies when a newly born foal is brought into this world," said Celestia.

"But what is going to happen now that the babies have been born?" asked Twilight

"The miracle of parenthood, my young student. This is known as raising your child," replied Princess Celestia.

1131322211121.content:
During her stay at the hospital, Twilight had grown close to the two new foals. They were able to stand not too terribly long after their birth, and they managed to take their first few wobbly steps then as well, but most of the time, they sat with their mother. Twilight had decided to name them Celestia and Luna, since she noticed their coat colorings had a day and night theme to them.

A few hours later, Twilight had recovered enough from the labor and was allowed to leave the hospital with her new babies. Carrying Celestia and Luna in two special foal-carrying saddlebags, she got home, only to be greeted with a Pinkie Pie-sized surprise.

"SURPRISE!" shouted Pinkie Pie, Rainbow Dash, Fluttershy, Rarity, Applejack, and Spike.

The noise startled both foals, and they began to cry. "Oh no!" said Twilight, trying to get the foals to calm down. When the two tiny fillies had stopped crying and were more relaxed, Twilight turned towards her friends and said, "Everyone, I thank you for throwing me and my new babies a party, but you need to keep quiet. Remember, they were just born today."

"Oh... um, we're sorry Twilight, but Pinkie Pie just wanted to make a good first impression," said Fluttershy, looking at the foals, who were shaken but feeling better.

"It's alright, everyone. You didnt mean to," said Twilight, as she took Celestia and Luna out of the sattlebags and placed them on the floor. "And while you're all here, anyone wanna see them? Just be gentle, though, they are quite precious."

"OOH OOH ME FIRST PLEASE! "said Rainbow Dash, with puppy dog eyes.

Twilight sighed, "Fine. Just be gentle."

As Rainbow Dash picked up Luna, the baby foal began to gurgle and drool a little, which looked so adorable to Rainbow Dash. Luna then began to giggle at Rainbow Dash.

"You seem to be uncharacteristically enjoying this," Twilight said.

"Hey, can't I have a soft spot for little foals and fillies?" Rainbow Dash asked in response, "I personally have always wanted to be an older sister, but my mom said that I wouldn't be a very good role model, for some reason."

Meanwhile, Fluttershy was holding Celestia gently. Usually, she was shy around other ponies outside of close friends, but she seemed to have a soft spot for children, especially foals. Celestia began nuzzling up against Fluttershy's chest and sucking on her hoof as Fluttershy stroked her fur.

Each one of them got turns at holding both of Twilight's new foals. As they were about to leave Twilight in peace with Spike, Celestia and Luna, Twilight told them they would be welcome to see them again.

As the two observers, Twilight and Fetal Celestia watched, they began to talk to each other.

"I've been thinking about this world," Twilight said, "Like, if you two are now babies, who's ruling Equestria, and how did I wind up getting pregnant with you two? This is an alternate reality, right?"

"It is, indeed, Twilight, but I'm sure we'll get some answers in due time," said Celesta, telepathically.

And so what next?

"Fine." Twilight sighed. "Just inform somepony about this, will you? I'd hate to have to explain to the staff and the guards where you disappeared to, okay?"

Luna nodded. "Off course."

-

Luna returned soon after. "Commander Shining Armor has been informed." Luna said. "As have the rest of the staff. By the end of the day, you will rule the kingdom."

"Now there's a bad idea." Twilight muttered. "Hush now Twilight." Celestia said to her. "You'll do fine. Besides, all you truly need to do is lower and raise the sun and moon. Much of the ruling is done by the various ministers, you know that."

"Sister is right." Luna said. "We will attempt to teach you as much as we can before we are reborn."

A chill spread across Twilight. "What will happen to you? When you're born again? Will you still be you? Or will you be foals in everything?"

"Only one way to find out." Luna said boldly before shedding her royal garments, throwing her crown and halter onto Celestia's bed. She kicked off her custom horseshoes and approached Twilight.

"Okay then... let's get started then." Twilight said nervously.

Her horn began to glow as she repeated the process that had got her into this situation. Again she placed a large amount of magic into the spell.

She took a step back as Luna began to shrink, her mane lost its ethereal glow and became solid once more. Years melted away like ice on a hot summer day.

Soon Luna was the size of the CMC and then even smaller.

She crashed to the ground, her legs no longer strong enough to hold her. Twilight levitated Luna towards her and held her closely.

And then she was gone.

Her stomach began to expand even more than it already had.

But so did she. Her legs became longer and her torso wider. Her face formed into a much sharper muzzle.

Right now she looked like princess Celestia had looked, only with purple coat and a mane that shimmered like earliest twilight. Only one thing was missing.

Two wings erupted from her back, drops of blood dripping off of them. Strangely, they did not hurt in the slightest. Twilight gave them an experimental flutter.

"Did it work?" She asked out loud. "I think so." Celestia said. "It's a lot more crowded in here now."

"Move over." Luna said through telepathy.

"I'm so tired all of a sudden." Twilight muttered. "I'm going to lay down for a bit."

She crashed rather unceremoniously onto Celestia's bed. A hoof strayed to her swollen stomach, feeling the light kicks of two Alicorn fillies, her daughters.

With that in mind, she fell asleep.

When Twilight came to, she was still on the princess' bed, and she was feeling dazed. "Wow," she said upon waking up, "I just had the craziest dream that I became pregnant with Princess Celestia and I learned that she was my real mother and I..." she trailed off as she looked down and noticed that she was indeed pregnant. She had to restrain herself from screaming. "So then it wasn't a dream?" she asked. Then it came back to her: she was still curious about what Celestia had told her.

Switching to telepathy, Twilight said, "Princess Celestia, can you hear me? Hello?"

She heard a gentle snoozing and figured she had fallen asleep inside her womb. As much as she didn't want to interrupt a sleeping fetus, she leaned forward and nuzzled her belly firmly, not too hard, but enough to jolt the princess awake. "ZZZ... Huh? Huh? Wha?"

"Princess, are you awake?"

"Huh? Oh, yes, I am." Inside the womb, Celestia yawned, rubbed her eyes, and stretched her legs as best as she could. Twilight could feel and see Celestia's little hooves pushing up against the side of her belly.

"Princess Celestia, you've got a lot of explaining to do."

"It's about me being your real mother, is that it?"

"Exactly."

"Oh dear. I hope you're not too angry with me over what you've learned."

Twilight said...

Celestia knew that she was right and sadly replied, "Well...I am sorry."

Twilight felt a little guilty for yelling at her mother. She knew that she was wrong for lying, but the pony inside of her was still a kind-hearted mentor. So she calmly replied, "Well, I am sorry, mother, I guess I won't understand."

11313222212.content:
Twilight did feel faint, but she quickly shook it off. She had more on her mind regarding this revelation. As she thought about all this, she was getting really angry at Celestia for keeping this all from her. She didn't have to worry about talking back to her with any major consequences, now that Celestia was inside of Twilight and mostly powerless at this point, so she glared down at her belly. Celestia was inside and couldn't see it, bur she could feel the anger and the feeling of betrayal from her dear student and daughter.

"So you wouldn't consider me in the royal family just because I wasn't an alicorn? And then you gave me away to two random ponies that I THOUGHT were my parents? You just threw me out like I was GARBAGE?!!? You rejected me?!!?"

"No, Twilight, that's not what I m-!"

"I TRUSTED YOU, you miserable, insignificant foal! I HAD FAITH IN YOU! You taught me all about magic and about life and other things, and yet you didn't even have the guts to tell me THE TRUTH ABOUT WHO I AM?!!? Why did you never tell me this? Why did you lie to me?" Tears were streaming down Twilight's face, and she was clearly furious. From inside, Celestia was deeply hurt by this response from Twilight, and a few tears started to fill her eyes. She sniffled as she tried to communicate with her angry young mare.

"Please, Twilight, if you'd just let me expla-!"

"I HATE YOU!!! WHEN THIS IS THROUGH, I DON'T EVER WANT TO SEE OR HEAR FROM YOU AGAIN, YOU... YOU JERK!!!"

It was silent after that. And then, Twilight heard something. It sounded like crying, and it was. She heard Celestia crying, not like a normal baby, but quietly sobbing, and it was the most pitiful, heartbreaking sound she had ever heard. She had been angry up to then, but as she listened to this beautiful voice of the princess, her mother weeping, her anger subsided. It was now replaced with sadness and guilt, and she could feel tears welling up as she realized what she just did to her. It wasn't long before she broke down and began sobbing herself. She leaned forward and tried her best to hug onto her belly, and hopefully Celestia as well. Inside, Celestia was trying her best to hug at Twilight as she could feel her up against the uterus wall. Eventually, through sheer coincidence and luck, they managed to grab each other in a hug, in spite of the uterus that separated them.

"Mother! Mother, I'm sorry for getting angry at you and saying I hated you!"

"And I'm sorry for keeping all this from you in the first place!"

As they held onto each other as best as they could through a womb, Twilight thought about her teacher, and suddenly everything seemed to make sense as to why she would have been Twilight's mother. Not only from her high magic power, but also for the fact that all her life, Celestia treated her not only as a student, but as a mother as well. Soon, both Twilight and Celestia began thinking about memories of when they were together while they held each other at the same time. The silence was broken when Twilight heard Celestia telepathically say, "Twilight, I love you."

"I-I love you too, Mother..."

Eventually, they let go of each other and Twilight resumed her relaxed position. Celestia again broke the silence. "So, would you like to learn more about this?"

Twilight said...

Celestia sighed and began telepathically speaking as if she was out of breath, "Well, Twilight... you remember... what I told your friends... about Discord ruling over Equestria before?"

"Yes, princess. Is he back? Oh no!"

"Oh, for Equestria's sake, no. Actually, I have something else about him."

Twilight sighed in relief. "Okay, then what is it? I'm all ears."

From inside the womb, Celestia closed her eyes sadly. "I lied about Discord. He never ruled over Equestria in the first place, nor created any of the chaos that I forewarned you about. I just told you that because the truth is... that I created the chaos."

Twilight didn't believe her and laughed. "Celestia, you always tell the best jokes, but okay, really, what happened?"

"I am not making this up. Sure, you saw Discord, but the only reason he exists is because...well, I created him."

Twilight frowned at this. "So you ARE telling the truth, but why would you lie to us?"

Celestia shamefully replied, "Well, it was the only way to... actually, I was scared."

Twilight felt like she got slapped in the face. "You were scared? Of what? So that serious tone you took was only a facade? What else were you hiding? That you could still use the Elements even when you said you couldn't? I can't believe you would lie to not only me, but my friends too!" A tear drop slowly fell from her face from how hurtful her own teacher's deception had been.

"I know this is a lot for you to handle right now, but please understand I couldn't just tell you that I had created a monster."

"So you think lying to us would help? Not only that, but you actually sent us to solve a problem you clearly made to cover up a dirty little secret? Why in Equestria would you EVER do something like that? Why would you ever create a chaos obsessed beast, lie to me and my friends, and then send us after said beast when it was clearly dangerous to do so? We could have been enslaved forever! And now I am stuck with you and not only that but I have to give birth to... I can't even say it!"

Celestia just stayed silent and began crying as she thought about what she had done. Twilight could hear this crying, and while she felt guilty about making her beloved Celestia cry, she was still upset and demanding answers.

113132222221121.content:
Celestia sighed. "The truth is, Twilight, Discord existed even before he started causing chaos. At least, he partially existed."

         "Partially existed? What does that mean?" asked Twilight.

         "The thing is, Discord was... well, put simply, he was an imaginary friend of mine. I enjoyed playing with Luna, but sometimes I'd be called away on 'royal business', even when I was young. So, I came up with somepony to keep me entertained while I was seperated from her. Discord actually started out in my mind as an alicorn colt named Terra, as in earth. That's why he has a brown coat." Celestia's mental voice had acquired a wistful tone as she thought about those lost days.

         Despite herself, Twilight smiled. "Well, we all had imaginary friends at some point, Princess. Hay, I used to have a pegasus friend named Surprise, to cheer me up when I got down in the dumps. Though, I sort of forgot about her after I became your student."

         Celestia chuckled. "Yes, well, as the years wore on, I entered my teenage years, and I was... well, pardon my language, but I was a bit of a slut. I flirted with every stallion I saw, and even a few mares. It got to the point where my parents confined me to my room to keep 'Molestia' from doing anything unbecoming of a princess."

         Twilight blushed. "You were seriously that flirtacious as a teenager? Wow. I never knew."

         "I'm not exactly proud of that phase of my life, Twilight," replied the princess. "Anyway, after being confined to my room, I turned to Terra for comfort. I got to picturing what he'd look like as an adolescent. I concentrated on every. Last. Detail."

         Twilight sighed. She knew emotions could have unpredictable effects when magic was involved. "And add a bit of wild magic from you, due to your emotional state..."

         "Yes. There was a burst of magic, and when my vision cleared, I saw Terra in front of me, just as I pictured him. And oh, he was gorgeous! I swear, I nearly tackled him." Celestia's blush was audible through her mental voice.

         Twilight giggled. "Were you in heat or something, princess?"

         Celestia paused. "You know, I might have been. I'm not sure. It's been a while. At any rate, since a strange pony appearing in the bedchambers of a princess would raise a lot of suspicion, he hid whenever somepony else came, or when I left. And for a while, it looked pretty good. We were steadily growing closer. Until that one event that doomed our relationship."

         Twilight was enthralled by the story. "What happened?"

         Celestia sighed. "We'd gotten lax in our precautions regarding others coming to my room. We were making out one day, when Luna walked in through the door I'd left unlocked. And Luna has always been a bit... loud."

         "Oh, dear..." Twilight murmured.

         "Yes. My mother and father came running when she started shrieking, and Terra was summarily ejected from the castle. The only reason he wasn't thrown in the dungeon was because I pleaded with my parents for mercy on his behalf. Still, after he was gone, I realized I couldn't remember any of the details I'd used to think him up in the first place. It was as though once he became real, I'd forgotten how he came to be. That was probably the biggest sulking phase of my life." Celestia sounded bitter. "Initially, I blamed Luna for disturbing us, but I realized later that it would have happened eventually."

         Twilight nodded. "So you lost your imaginary friend turned real. When did he become Discord?"

         Celestia's voice grew somber. "I heard nothing of Terra for ten years. Not once did he try to reach me. Not once did he write to me. I was crushed during the first year, but with Luna's help, I began to move on. Then, ten years after he left my life, cotton candy clouds began popping up around the world."

         "Sounds familiar," deadpanned Twilight.

         "Indeed," agreed the princess. "Since Luna and I could manipulate the weather, we decided to lead a team of pegasi to investigate. Soon, though, we spotted other signs of chaos. Animals being altered, buildings turned into plywood cutouts...We eventually zeroed in on the source, and found a patchwork beast calling itself Discord. We attempted to reason with him, to get him to stop, but he told me that I couldn't sway his heart like I used to. It was then that I recognized his voice. Terra's loneliness and jealousy twisted him into becoming Discord. So, you see Twilight, I was at least partially responsible for one of the greatest threats to Equestria. I've never truly forgiven myself for it."

         Twilight was silent as she thought about what her mentor had told her. How was she feeling about this particular revelation?

113132222222221.content:
Twilight's eyes nearly bugged out of her head at that. "WHAT?!" she cried out mentally. It took a bit of effort not to do so physically as well.

         "Well, 'siblings' may be slightly inaccurate. But, suffice to say the six of you share the same heritage," Celestia explained.

         "Pardon my language, Princess, but what the bucking hay does that mean?!" Twilight exclaimed, several hairs in her mane popping out of place.

         "It's complicated, Twilight. I suppose the easiest way to explain it is that... well, there's a very good reason the six of you can bear the Elements of Harmony," Celestia elaborated. "All of you are actually the living embodiments of the Elements themselves. The Elements were the ones who... impregnated your respective mothers, under the cover of each of your fathers. You were all connected before any of you were even born."

         Twilight reeled. This was... mind-blowing, to say the least. And yet... hadn't she felt it, that first night? That tingling sense of familiarity, the closeness that only family could normally provide? Twilight hadn't given it much thought afterwards, considering what had happened, but now she recalled that warmth that had flowed through her. "Siblings..." she murmured. "All of my friends... are actually my siblings?"

         "Not in the traditional sense. But yes, you are all related, thanks to the Elements." Celestia gave off a feeling of sadness. "I'm sorry I never told you. I wasn't even sure myself what had happened until after you brought Luna back. When I studied those necklaces and the tiara, I realized that they were mere foci for the powers that lay dormant within you."

         "So... what exactly does it mean to be a living embodiment of an Element?" Twilight asked, her shock fading into curiosity.

         "It varies depending on the Element in question. You, Twilight, are the embodiment of Magic, and thus are adept at any spell, no matter how obscure or esoteric. In addition, your magical reserves will grow at an exponential rate as you grow older. Why, when you get old enough, you may well outstrip me in terms of raw power!" Celestia chuckled a little.

         Twilight, on the other hoof, was blushing furiously. "But... but your the Princess of the Sun! You're saying I could be more powerful than you?"

         "And you'll have more than enough time to do it in," Celestia added.

         Twilight frowned. "Princess, what do you mean by that?"

         There was a heavy mental sigh. "Twilight, this may cause you no small amount of grief, but you need to know. To be an embodiment of an Element of Harmony means you are not as restricted by mortal chains as other ponies. Neither you nor your friends will die of old age, or indeed of any natural cause. And if, Lauren forbid, you are slain by something, you will return, given enough time. In essence, the six of you are as immortal as my sister and myself."

         Twilight had thought she was shocked before. She was absolutely floored, now. Immortal? Her? And all of her friends, too? And... "Who's Lauren?" A part of her mind face-hoofed at the question.

         "My mother," Celestia replied.

         Twilight blinked repeatedly. "I... I don't think I've ever read about your mother, Princess."

         "You wouldn't have," Celestia replied. "Lauren Faust, aside from giving birth to Luna and myself, never did anything noteworthy in her time... officially. She erased all traces of herself from the Archives when she left this world." Celestia sighed. "We're getting off topic. How do you feel about being immortal, Twilight?"

         Twilight hesitated. How did she feel?

113132222222222222211.content:
Despite thinking the concept utterly ridiculous, Twilight settled herself to listen to her mentor's story. "A third alicorn?"

         "That's correct,"Celestia replied. "While I ruled the sun, and Luna ruled the moon, Millennia had a very special role; she was the guardian of Time itself. As such, she existed outside the standard temporal stream. This means that while Luna and I were mere foals, Millennia was already a grown mare, whenever she chose to walk the land. Millennia's powers allowed her to warp time around her, to a limited degree. She could accelerate certain things to make them appear to move faster, or decelerate others to make them appear slower. However, she could not truly go back in time to change history, because such an act is impossible. The past is set in stone."

         "I think I found that out the hard way," muttered Twilight, remembering the whole fiasco that had eventually resolved in her creation of a stable time loop.

         Celestia chuckled, remembering that incident as well. "Yes, well, Millennia eventually caught the attention of Discord. He managed to trap her, and broke her into six fragments of power. This fragments are what you know as the Elements of Harmony."

         "So the Elements are... fragments of a long-dead alicorn?" asked Twilight, feeling rather ill about the idea.

         "Yes. But there's more to it than that. When Discord broke her power, he also broke her spirit. The process caused Millennia to trigger her temporal magic, and it spiraled out of control, flinging the fragments of her spirit through time. Eventually, they settled into six different ponies. That is to say, you and your friends."

         "So, we're not really one pony, we just each carry a fragment of a single pony within us," Twilight mused.

         "Yes, that's a more reasonable way to look at it," agreed Celestia. "My earlier word choice was a bit off, I suppose."

         "So, the fact that we each carry a fragment of Millennia is what allows us to use the Elements of Harmony so effectively, right? I mean, we carry fragments of her spirit, and the Elements are fragments of her power, right?" Twilight sounded enthusiastic about solving a puzzle that had bothered her for some time.

         "Yes, exactly. But I admit, Twilight, there's a bit of risk involved in using the Elements."

         Twilight blinked. "What do you mean? What risk?"

         "The more often you use the Elements of Harmony, the more likely it is that memories of Millennia's will begin to surface in each of you. When her power and her spirit are reunited in their entirety, some side effects are expected." Celestia paused to let Twilight absorb the information.

         Twilight's eyes widened as she remembered something. "Wait! On our way to retrieve the Elements the first time, Rarity gave up part of her tail to replace a sea serpent's moustache! But when we used the Elements, her tail was restored!"

         Celestia nodded. "Millennia was often hailed as a great healer. But she never truly healed anypony. Rather, she turned back time just a little bit in a small area to completely remove injuries. It was sort of cheating the 'past written in stone' concept we discussed earlier. She never did anything too drastic, however."

         Twilight nodded, then cocked her head. "But what exactly is the risk with using the Elements too often?"

         Celestia sighed. "The more often the Elements are used, as I said before, the more likely Millennia's memories will surface. Use them too often, and... well, simply put, the confusion of your memories will drive each of you insane."

11332.content:
Spike was left blinking at that. "So...wait a minute. You're telling me you can turn a mare into a stallion?"

         Twilight blushed, but nodded. "That's it exactly. I designed the spell to make things easier for same-gender couples who want a kid of their own, but don't want to adopt."

         Spike nodded slowly. "I guess that sounds reasonable...But have you tested it yet?"

         "Well, yes," Twilight replied, "I did some tests on some of Fluttershy's animals...with her permission, of course! I changed them for a few minutes, then changed them back."

         "Good to know it's reversible," Spike said with a nod. "But...wait, have you even tried this on ponies yet?"

         "Um...well, yes. I tried it on one pony, after asking her permission. By the way, you might want to avoid Lyra and BonBon's house in the near future."

         Spike blanched. "I did NOT need to know that, Twi! I mean, okay, they're a cute couple, but seriously!"

         "Sorry, but you did ask," the unicorn reminded him.

         "Right...Note to self: never ask about Twilight's spells again."

         Twilight rolled her eyes at the behavior of her assistant, and began packing for the trip to Canterlot. She had kept silent about her true motives behind developing the spell, however. Maybe with this spell, I can be with her...

***


         When Twilight arrived at Canterlot, her first stop was her old library. She dropped Spike off there, and asked him to take a few books from here that the Ponyville library didn't have. In the meantime, she set off to find Princess Celestia. It didn't take her too long; the princess was currently relaxing in her bedchambers.

         "Ah, Twilight! I'm glad you made it," Celestia said, rising to her forehooves from the cushion she'd been lying down on.

         "I'm always ready to answer a summons, Princess," Twilight replied with a bow.

         The alicorn chuckled. "Twilight, there's no need to be so formal. Here, in this room, it's just you and me. We can speak freely about anything you wish to speak about."

         Twilight managed to hide a blush at what she'd REALLY like to talk about, and coughed. "Well, in your letter, you said you were interested in the spell I was developing, right?"

         "Indeed, although you still haven't told me what it does," Celestia replied.

         "Well, it's...for lack of a better phrase, it's a gender-swapping spell. I can use it to change somepony from one gender to the other and back," Twilight explained. "I've already tested it out, and it seems to work rather well."

         Celestia's eyebrows rose clear up to the forelock of her mane. "I see...and have you thought about the possible long-term consequences for keeping somepony as the other gender?"

         Twilight nodded. "I thought about the hormone imbalance that could result, so I came up with a solution. The spell not only changes the body, but the hormones currently in the body as well. Estrogen becomes testosterone, and vice versa."

         "Hm...it sounds like you've put some thought into this, my faithful student," Celestia mused. "But why so much work on this one spell?"

         "Well, like I told Spike, I designed it for same-gender couples who want a kid, but don't want to adopt," Twilight explained. "It's easily reversible, too. Though, I haven't learned what would happen if I used it on somepony who was pregnant. And I don't think I'd care to find out."

         "Nor would I," Celestia agreed with a shiver. Then her features smoothed into a mask of perfect neutrality. "Are you sure this has nothing to do with your crush on me?"

         Twilight's brain shut down at that, as she stared wide-eyed and open-mouthed at her mentor. Her jaw worked, but nothing came out. Inwardly, her thoughts were going a mile a minute. Ohmigoshohmigoshohmigosh she knows I'm so stupid of course she knows she knows everything but why didn't she say anything -

         Seeing her student's dumbfounded expression, Celestia smiled. "I've known for some time what your true feelings for me were. I never confronted you about them because, well, I was honestly flattered. Hardly anypony is brave enough to talk to me face to face, let alone wear their heart in the open around me."

         Twilight blinked, and her jaw closed. "You mean...you're not upset?"

         "Twilight, why would I be upset?" the alicorn asked, reaching over to draw Twilight into a hug. "Like I said, I find it flattering that I can still draw romantic interest from somepony...even if said pony is my student."

         Twilight melted into the hug, and eagerly returned it. "Well...in that case, you found me out, Princess. I did develop this spell for the two of us. It sounds a bit presumptuous, but...well, I've been head-over-hooves for you almost since becoming your student. I just...had this feeling, deep in my heart, that we would be together one day." She looked up into Celestia's eyes, which were...

1133211.content:
Twilight smiled softly. "By 'somepony', do you mean me, Princess? Because I have to say, I think it'd cause a bit of a panic if you were a stallion, even for a while."

         Celestia smiled back, nuzzling Twilight. "I havve to admit, I've been curious for some time what you'd be like as a stallion, my faithful student. And I'm quite anxious to find out."

         Twilight nodded, and stepped back. "You might want to shield your eyes, Princess. This spell is kinda bright when I cast it."

         Celestia smirked. "Brighter than the sun?"

         Twilight blushed. "Oh, right! Hehe..." She closed her eyes, and let her magic begin to flow.

         Celestia watched intently as the magic wrapped around her student, sort of like a cocoon. She was reminded briefly of the spell that had gifted Rarity with a pair of gossamer wings. Wings that had burned off when she'd flown too high. Still, that spell didn't take this long to cast. Celestia maintained her vigil, even though her student was completely obscured by her own magic. Suddenly, there was a brilliant flash of light, bright enough that the Princess was forced to close her eyes briefly. When she opened them again, she gasped at what she saw.

         Twilight had never been the best-looking unicorn mare. Oh, certainly, she was attractive, but in a bookish sort of way. She wasn't in the same league as Rarity or Sapphire Shores. But the unicorn stallion standing where Twilight had been was an absolutely perfect specimen. Broad shoulders were supported by lean, yet muscular legs. The mane and tail were shorter than they had been, yet no less out-of-place. He had grown in height a little, and his horn had lengthened. And his flanks! Celestia actually had to stop herself from drooling. His flanks were absolutely perfect! And the starburst cutie mark looked very tempting, placed on such firm cheeks!

         The stallion shook his head. "Phew... I should have done a self-test a while ago. That was certainly different." He blinked, and coughed. "And my voice has changed, too." Indeed it had. It had gone from the cheerful contralto to a soothing baritone. He smiled. "Well, it seems to have worked." Looking up, he saw the Princess's eyes had glazed over slightly. "Um, Princess?"

         Shaking herself, Celestia recovered her senses. "Most impressive, my faithful student." She stood up, and motioned for him to follow. She led him to her bedchambers, and closed the door behind him. "Now then, let me personally inspect the results..."

113331.content:
Spike looked a little confused.

"Swapping what?" he asked.

"Oh; it could be anything they wanted," answered Twilight. "One could swap voices, ages, sizes, bodies, intellects, genders, mobilities, perceptions..."

"Wait a minute..." said Spike. "What do you mean by those last two?"

Twilight smiled. "Well; say that I wanted to swap mobility with you, Spike, then I would be able to move around on just two legs, while you would have to walk on all fours."

Spike looked more than a little spooked. "And the other one?"

"Well; the perception swap is a little tricky. It swaps perceptions on something between two individuals. The problem is that the two who afe affected will believe that it is normal for the other one to have what they swapped with them and vice versa."

Noticing that Spike looked even more confused than before, she tried to simplify it.

"Basically; if I should choose to swap perceptions on our bodies with you, Spike, we would still remain in our own bodies. However, I would now think that I was really in your body, while you would think that you were in mine. In other words, we would both think that we shouuld really be in each other's bodies."

Spike's face showed that he understood now.

"Wow, Twilight, that sound like a pretty powerful spell. Maybe you should try it out before you visit Celestia, just to make sure that there's nothing wrong."

"Good idea, Spike," said Twilight. "Would you care to be my swapping partner?"

When Spike looked nervous, Twilight said: "I'll let you choose what we should swap between us. Don't worry; I'll swap everything back to normal before I have to visit Celestia. Okay?"

Spike sighed. "Okay, then."

"Good. Now, what would you like for us to swap?"

"Hmmm... That's a though one," said Spike. After a few moments of thinking, he said: "Alright, I want you and I to..."

11333131.content:
“Swap species!" Twilight said, rubbing her hooves together. "So I’ll become a dragon and you’ll become a pony”

Spike blinked

“Are you sure this is safe?”

Twilight glared at him.

“Are you saying my spells aren’t safe?!”

“Wellllll there was time at the left tower of Celestia's castle. And-"

“I promise nothing will blow up. Or that you’ll turn into a potted plant.” Twilight sighed. “ I wouldn’t use this spell on you if I thought it would harm you, I promise. This is safe and I know, but I'm not going to force you into. Do you still want to do this or not?"

Spike though about it for a second

“Ok, give it a shot.”

Twilight concentrated. Her horn flared with purple, and her magical aura surrounded herself and spike. A strange feeling ran through them. Spike felt his balance wobble, as his arms suddenly grew too large for his body. He tried to catch his balance as he fell, and found himself looking as a pair of hooves.

“Woah!” He looked over his shoulder at the rest of his body. His back legs had changed into horse legs, and his scaly dragon tail was turning into a length of green fur. Spike's mouth felt strange as it reshaped itself into a snout and his scalp prickled as the fins on his head turned into a green mane. He briefly felt a throbbing feeling on top of his and instinctively felt it with a hoof. A small unicorn horn grew out of his head.

“Neat! I always wanted to do magic!” He had gotten so wrapped up in his transformation he had completely taken his eyes off Twilight. “How are you doing Twilight?”

Twilight was similarly eager to watch herself transform. Her fur was gone, replaced with purple scales, purple spines grew out of her back and her tail had become longer and scaly. Twilight fumbled for balance as her front hooves turned to hands and she fell forward

“Waah!” Twilight crashed into the ground. “I never thought about balance.”

She picked herself up but everything seemed different. Had the spell not finished?
