1153321111121.title: I've always wanted to fly!

11533211112.content:
"What?" Twilight uttered. "Princess, please! It's me, Twilight!"

"I've heard enough." Celestia said calmly. "Guards!" She called out. At her command, half a dozen guards appeared in Twilight's room. "Take this... thing into custody. We'll see if a few nights in the dungeon will loosen her lips."

Twilight cried as the guards chained her up and dragged her away. Her friends looked at her, their faces showing their confusion.

-

The former purple Unicorn sat in her cell, alone. She felt cold and hungry. The soup she had been given an hour ago had done nothing to still her hunger and the bread tasted stale and bland, even though it was obviously fresh. At least Celestia took care of her prisoners.

"How could she?" Twilight muttered. "I've always been loyal to her! I loved her like she was my mother!" She screamed in anger.

"Calm down in there." The warden said. "And keep quiet, or else I'll- agh!" The warden dropped to the ground, a sizable bump on his head.

Twilight blinked in surprise and looked out through the bars to see her would-be savior.
11533211112.title: She doesn't: "I will ask you once: Wher...

choices: A court trial has been called
115332111121.content:
Continue
Her loyal friends
Twilight was locked up in her cell. She heard crying ponies, hissing, and many other creepy sounds of the dungeon. However, she was at least in a nice prison. Her cell was nice and clean and she wasn't chained up like she pictured it. She sat in there thinking about her future.
She had many thoughts swirling around in her head like, what if I never get out, what's going to happen to my home, what's going to happen to me, am I going to be stuck here forever... These thoughts made her feel hopeless but she wasn't aware of the things going on outside of the dungeon.
Her friends, coming from Equestria, were in the city of Canterlot. In fact they were already inside the castle, past the perimeter and borderline, and walking beside Celestia in the dungeon. They were closing in on Twilight's cell.
Twilight looked out through her bars, trying to see what the guards were doing, but she went back inside her cell to sit down and think some more. As she did so she saw her friend Pinkie Pie, more or less heard her voice, and quickly perked up. She stood and looked out her cell to see if her friends were there and they were. All of them were there walking in her direction.
This excited her, not too much, but it at least brought some hope. Her friends saw her cell number and stopped right in front of it. She looked at all of them.
The guard was talking with Celestia about her and after a quick conversation, the guard unlocked her cell.

What happens next?
115332111121.title: Her friends!

choices: Twilight tries to escape the Changling
115332111122.content:
Twilight blinked in surprise to see her savior, in the shadows was a strange figure looking similar to hers.

"W-who are you?" Twilight yelled out to her lone savior, standing over to the knocked out warden.

"I'm here t-to sssssssssave you!" A loud and slithered voice echoed throughout the dungeon, the figure in the shadows moving closer into the light to reveal another Changling walking up to the dungeon bars. His body and shape was very similar to Twilight's new body, he had holes in his legs and he had insect-like wings similar to Twilight's except their were much bigger and fierce looking.

"Save me?" Twilight backed away from the bars, trying to stand away from the rather large Changling who stood on the other side of the bars.

"Yesssss...." He slithered, letting his tongue spit out like a snake.

"But the princesses and their guards might catch you down here and lock you away." Twilight moved away, backing herself up to the wall.

"No time!" He shouted.

And with that, the large Changling head butted the iron bars that sealed Twilight on the inside. Causing them to fall of their hinges and fall to the ground causing a large bang, his horn ripped through the iron bars like nothing and he proceeded to walk over to Twilight.

"The Queen wantsssss to ssssseee you!" He slithered out.
115332111122.title: A Changeling?

choices: Chrysalis comes clean and tells her
Chrysalis leads her on, deceiving her
1153321111221.content:
"Okay then." Twilight didn't like the prospect of following this changeling, but he had saved her while everypony else abandoned her.

"This way, quickly!" The Changeling hissed as he lead her out of the cell.

Much to Twilight's surprise he led her deeper into the dungeons.

Soon enough they came to a huge black gate. The Changeling pounded on it. "I have her!" He screeched. "Open, now!"

The door swung open. The Changeling pulled Twilight along with him and the door closed behind them.

Twilight blinked a few times, to get used to the strange light coming of from the walls. She was in the crystal caverns underneath Canterlot again.

"Go see the queen now." He said, pointing to the tall and slender Changeling standing a bit deeper into the cave.

-

"Twilight Sparkle." Queen Chrysalis said. "How lovely to see you. And so beautiful too."

"Can it." Twilight said. "You did this to me, didn't you?"
1153321111221.title: Twilight follows the Changling

choices: She doesn't agree and a guard comes
11533211112211.content:
Continue
The hard truth
Chrysalis came clean and just told her straight up, "You are right, I did do this to you but the purpose wasn't for pain."
Twilight was surprised that she would just come clean to her and replied, "Um...so why did you bring me here?"
Chrysalis expected this response and replied, " I wanted to examine the results."
Twilight demanded, "Well you see what you did so change me back now!"
Chrysalis wasn't moved and responded, " No, unless you make a deal with me. You are already in trouble so you might as well start right."
Twilight was angry about making a deal with someone she hated so much but she figured that it was the only way to get her out of her situation. So she responded, "Okay, what do you want?"
Chrysalis was relieved to find her plan working so easily so she said, "If you can convince Princess Celestia to get me out of here then I will turn you back to yourself."
Twilight wasn't too pleased with this challenge because of the way Celestia treated her earlier. She didn't even think she could convince Celestia to get her out if the dungeon, especially if she was caught trying to escape. However this seemed like her only option. She responded, " I would rather be a changeling but I want to ask you something."
Chrysalis was confused at this response and replied, " What isss it my darling?"
Twilight responded, "I might consider changing my mind but only if you (looks around) teach me how to use my powers as a changeling. My only chance to convince Celestia to let someone like you out is to do it as Twilight. What do you say?

What happens next?
11533211112211.title: Chrysalis comes clean and tells her

choices: Twilight chooses to stick with the Changlings
Twilight chooses to leave Equestria and run away from her problems
11533211112212.content:
"Me?" The Changling Queen cocked her head backwards, a small crowd of random Changlings began to swarm around their Queen and the strange Changling that they had never seen before. Twilight felt a little uneasy as the Changlings stood around her inspecting her body parts, she kept her eyes onto the Queen and waited for her response.

"Why would I change you into one of my own kind? You are not worthy enough to be a Changling. It's merely a magical happening that you have transformed into my own kind, yet you look beautiful for a female Changling." The Queen spoke in a loud and bombastic voice.

"How did I even turn into a changling in the first place?" Twilight asked the Queen, ignoring the snickering and laughter of the Changlings surrounding her.

"You tell me Twilight Sparkle." The Queen lowered her head closer to the new Changling looking deep into her eyes.

"I... I don't know... I woke up... and then I found out I was turned into a Changling, all of my friends came in to help me but Princess Celestia took me away and put me in the Canterlot dungeons." Twilight explained to the Queen, the Changling Queen put her hoof on her chin and began to ponder on what the ex-pony had just said to her.

"It seems that everything is not as it seems." The Changling Queen said, slowly walking up to Twilight.

"Wh-what do you mean?" Twilight raised her ears, she didn't understand what the Changling Queen was trying to say.

"Does this Princess Celestia trust you?" She asked.

"Yes." Twilight replied. "She trusts me with her heart and friendship, I have been her student since I was a little filly." She added.

"Then why did she throw you in the dungeons?" The Changling Queen asked, giving a small smirk on her face.

"I... I don't know... I didn't have time to explain..." Twilight broke, she didn't know what to say. She still needed to keep a flowing conversation with the Queen.

"Maybe... certain aspects about your life is just a lie." The Changling Queen said, causing some of the Changlings that looked at Twilight to laugh and snicker.

"I d-don't understand..." Twilight was stumped, how could such things come out of her mouth.

"You might have been a Changling from the beginning, but you weren't aware of your powers. What if the Princess knew about your real identity and she lead you on until the time was right." The Queen began to loudly speak.

"It can't be... my parents raised me... and the Princess wouldn't never ever lie to me!" Twilight protested.

"As you may know Twilight Sparkle, a Changling needs love to stay in their other forms to trick others. What if Celestia sent you to Ponyville to make friends to slowly suck off their love, knowing that your disguise would slowly fade away if you did not interact with other ponies." The Changling Queen looked down at Twilight, who was nearly about to burst into tears. "And when the love is gone and your disguise had faded away, the Princess had no need for you and threw you away into the dungeons."

Twilight couldn't believe this, many ideas and voices in her head telling which side to pick. She couldn't understand why the Princess would lie to her and she couldn't understand why the Changling Queen couldn't have warned her earlier, she doesn't know who to choose after being told these dark secrets, she needed someone to help her regain her normal form.

"If you want my advice Twilight Sparkle, you could stay with me and both of us could pay both the Princesses a visit..." The Changling Queen offered. "Or... you could run away and forget about this whole mess and lose yourself in the world that betrayed you."
11533211112212.title: Chrysalis leads her on, deceiving her

choices: Twilight gives in to the Changeling Queen, accepting her new fate
Twilight pretends to give in for now, hiding her true intent
115332111122121.content:
A war raged within Twilight. Part of her was still loyal to Princess Celestia, despite what had happened. That part of her was telling her to try and strike down the Changeling Queen. She quashed that thought, however, owing to the fact that she was outnumbered by a wide margin. That left the options Chrysalis herself had presented: join with the Changelings, or turn her back and run from her troubles.

         Oh, she hated this. She hated what had happened. But she knew that on her own, her chances of survival were next to nil. Slowly, she answered. "I... I'll stay with you... my Queen." By the Sun, forcing that out felt awful!

         The Queen appeared not to have noticed, however. "Wonderful!" She stepped down from the throne, inspecting her newest child. "Hmm... a little scrawny, but reasonably fit. And..." She trailed off, eyes wide as she beheld the second growth on Twilight's head. "Well, well, well, things are more complicated than I thought." She tapped the crown-shaped horn with a hoof.

         Twilight gasped at the contact. She hadn't been sure until now, but that second 'horn' was definitely attached. "Um, yeah, I was going to ask about that..." She paused, before adding, "My Queen."

         Inwardly, Chrysalis's mind was racing. That powder shouldn't have turned her into a royal Changeling! She must have incredible magic potential for that to happen! Outwardly, the Queen smiled. "That second horn marks you as a royal Changeling. For all intents and practical purposes, you are just below me in rank, owing to my seniority. Should anything befall me, you will be the one to run the Hive."

         Twilight gulped. "I... I don't know if I could handle that. And... what do you mean, the 'Hive'?"

         The Changeling Queen lowered her head, until her main horn touched Twilight's. "You haven't been connected to the Hive, my dear, so of course you wouldn't know." Her horn began to glow a sickly green. "I warn you; this will feel a little odd."

         Suddenly, Twilight felt a jolt run through her body and mind. She cried out, although the feeling wasn't painful. She fell to the floor, gasping as she tried to make sense of the sensation...

         Or rather, sensations. She could feel multiple things at the same time, and her vision seemed be be fractured as well. With a groan, she forced herself to focus on the image of her elder sister, and -

         That thought derailed whatever else had been running through her mind. Sister?! That Changeling isn't my sister! Why the hay did I just think that?!

         Her turmoil was evident on her face, as the elder Changeling leaned down. "Are you alright? It's a bit disorienting, when you're first connected to the Hive."

         "I... I'm not sure. I can... see and feel so many things! And... and when I looked at you a second ago, I thought you were my sister! What gives?!"

         Chrysalis smirked wryly. "I'll answer the second question first. You see, when a royal Changeling is connected to the Hive for the first time, any existing royals become their sibling by the bond that is shared. It's just a fundamental rule of our kind, my dear. As for what you are feeling and seeing, those are what all of our subordinates are feeling and seeing. Our subordinates are all bound to us. We feel everything they feel." She let that sink in for a moment.

         Twilight's eyes widened at the implications. "When Shining Armor and Cadence's spell washed through Canterlot..."

         Chrysalis nodded. "I felt not only the pain of my own body, but the pain each of my children felt as they were pushed out of the city. Some of my children weren't so lucky, being crushed against buildings and the like. Do you understand what it's like to be connected to somepony, and to have that pony die? It's almost unbearable. Now, picture that feeling multiplied many times over, along with multiple sensations of pain. That's what I had to endure with that spell."

         Twilight very nearly started crying. "But... but my brother and Cadence didn't mean to kill any of your children!"

         "Intentional or not, the damage was done!" Chrysalis snarled. "And now that you are connected to the Hive, you too will feel their pain. That should give you some incentive to keep them whole, should it not?"

         Twilight realized that she could not only feel the subordinate Changelings' sensations, but Chrysalis's as well. The Changeling Queen was angry at the deaths of her children. She was disappointed at having been denied her chance to feed her children forever. But most of all, she was thrilled for having a... successor?

         Twilight gulped. "Look, I just agreed to this because I have a better shot at survival with you than on my own. I never agreed to be a... 'royal' Changeling!"

         Chrysalis smiled sadly. "I understand, my dear. Your own survival came first. But your body spoke for you in this case. And, I'll be honest, I'm actually rather happy about this."

         Twilight blinked. "Huh? But, didn't I cause a lot of problems for you? Why would you be happy that I'm now just below you in Changeling hierarchy?"

         Chrysalis chuckled. "Haven't I made it clear? The well-being of the Hive is paramount. My own personal feelings are inconsequential. Though I won't deny, I find it a delicious irony that everything Celestia worked for will be undone by her student."

         "But... I..." Twilight tried to protest, although a part of her was agreeing with the Changeling before her.

         "Come now, my dear, I took you in when Celestia cast you aside. What does that say to you, hmm?" Chrysalis leaned down to whisper in Twilight's ear. "How can you defend somepony who betrayed you so utterly?"

         Another war raged within the former unicorn. How could she abandon Princess Celestia? And yet... how could she possibly defend her? What on Equestria was she supposed to do?
115332111122121.title: Descent into Darkness

1153321111221211.content:
"Celestia betrayed me. I'll join you." Twilight said. It broke her heart but Celestia had stepped on it first. "I don't understand, why would she betray me that easily?" She whined, looking down as tears formed.

Chrysalis sauntered over to her and put a hoof on her chin, lifting it up to look Twilight in the eyes. "My dear sister, dry your tears. She is not worth spilling them for. And neither are those other ponies you call friends."

"But-" Twilight tried to protest but Chrysalis laid a hoof on her mouth, silencing her.

"You were right, weren't you?" Chrysalis stated. "You knew that I, disguised as Cadance, was up to no good. But they ignored your warnings. They thought that you were a fool."

Twilight narrowed her eyes. "They did." She admitted.

"You were a very observant Pony." Chrysalis continued. "And yet they ignored the signs. All they wanted to see was the glitter and glamor that the wedding brought with it. Even Celestia."

Twilight nodded as Chrysalis withdrew her hoof.

"They are not worthy to be your friends." Chrysalis said. "What kind of friend ignores a pony so in distress? They are worthless."

"Yes, yes they are." Twilight's eyes glowed with a green shine. "I don't need them anymore, the Hive is all I need."

"Good." Chrysalis smirked. "Tonight when Celestia goes to her chambers, we will ambush her. We will corrupt her thoughts and we will rule through her." Chrysalis said.

"Won't she be suspicious?" Twilight said. "You sprung me from the dungeons, the security will be much tighter."

"All ready taken care of." Chrysalis said. "I've send a few Changelings to replace you and that warden that was knocked out. Celestia'll suspect nothing."

"Good." Twilight said. And she meant it.

"However, if you want to help tonight, I will need to teach you about your new powers." Chrysalis said. "A changeling that can't transform is useless. Even a royal one."

Twilight nodded.
1153321111221211.title: Twilight gives in to the Changeling Queen, acce...

choices: "...on bringing my old friends into the fold." (Mane 6)
"...on tearing out Celestia's heart like she tore out mine." (Luna)
11533211112212111.content:
Several hours later, Princess Celestia was in her bedchamber. She was attempting to read a dull treatise on the difference between weather formed in Everfree and weather made by ponies, all in an effort to go to sleep. She'd set the sun two hours ago, but she was still restless. Her thoughts kept drifting back to her missing student. When had the Changelings gotten to her? And where was she now? Even the absolutely soporific text in front of her wasn't calming her mind.

         Sighing, she put the book away, and laid on her back, staring at the ceiling. A tear fell from her eye. "Oh, Twilight... my beloved student... I promise, I'll do everything in my power to find and release you."

         A knock at the door startled her, but she composed herself quickly. "Yes?"

         The door opened, revealing a Royal Guard. "I just wanted to inform you that the imposter who took Miss Sparkle's place has fallen asleep."

         Celestia's eyes narrowed. "Good. Perhaps it will be more cooperative in the morning."

         The guard hesitated, noticing the streak that the tear had left behind. "Your Majesty? Are you alright?"

         Celestia considered lying, but decided honesty was best here. Beckoning the guard in, she shut the door behind him. "No, I am not alright. I'm worried about my student." Her face fell. "She... she tried to warn me. Tried to warn all of us of the Changeling Queen's intent. But we were too caught up in the glamour of the wedding to pay her any heed. I'm supposed to be better than that! Twilight's almost never been wrong about things like this!"

         The guard stepped forward. "Your Majesty, do not blame yourself. The Changeling Queen fooled everypony. And recall that Miss Sparkle managed to prove herself right in the end."

         "That just makes it worse!" Celestia cried, startling the guard. "I... I haven't even apologized to her for not believing her! And now, she's been taken by the very enemies she tried to warn me about!" Her eyes watered, and she buried her face in her hooves. "I'm a horrible mentor," she sobbed out. The guard stood nearby, looking extremely edgy about the way his ruler was now baring her soul to him. Surreptitiously, he slid a small metal band out of his armor into his hoof.

         After a moment, Celestia drew in a ragged breath, and wiped her eyes with a hoof. "My... my apologies for venting at you, my loyal guard. It's... been a trying couple of days."

         "Don't mention it," the guard said, with a familiar female voice. Celestia looked up, just in time for the metal band the guard had thrown to latch onto her horn. Instantly, she felt her connection to the sun vanish. More than that, she couldn't use magic at all. A quick flash of magic caught her attention, and she saw an almost invisible barrier appear around her chambers.

         "Seriously, don't mention it," the 'guard' said again, as green flames flickered around him. A moment later, the changeling that had impersonated Twilight Sparkle stood before her, a wicked grin on her face.

         "You! But how?! That cell was secure, nopony could have escaped!" Celestia was in shock. She'd just been duped by this imposter. Mentally, she made a note to devise a spell that could detect Changelings.

         "You don't give me nearly enough credit, Celestia," the Changeling said, chuckling cruelly. Her horn then glowed, and a few moments later, there was another burst of green flame.

         When the flame cleared, there before Celestia's horrified eyes stood the Changeling Queen. Looking at the Princess of the Sun, she laughed. "My, my, that went quicker than I would have thought!" Glancing around, she grinned. "And a soundproof barrier to boot! Excellent choices, my dear."

         Celestia reached with a hoof to try and remove the band around her horn. Unfortunately, it seemed to have adhered strongly to her horn. Giving up for the moment, she glared at the two Changelings. "Why have you dared to return? And where have you taken my student?"

         The Queen laughed long and hard. "Oh, she still doesn't understand, does she, Twilight?" she asked the other Changeling.

         The other laughed as well. "You'd think she'd be able to take a hint." Her laughter cut off abruptly as she stepped forward, glaring at Celestia with utter venom. "Let me say it one more time: I am Twilight Sparkle. I was the one who hatched a baby dragon and caused him to age rapidly in a burst of uncontrolled magic. I was the one you took in as a student. And I was the one you let sleep in your own bedchambers for the first month of being your student, because I was so frightened, being away from my family and all."

         Celestia's eyes widened. Only she and Twilight had ever known that detail. Suddenly, the true impact of what she'd done hit her. Oh, no...

         Seeing her reaction, Twilight continued her verbal offensive. "I have always done what you asked. I have served you faithfully for years! I considered you a second mother to me!" She was now in Celestia's face, and the alicorn felt incredibly small, despite towering over the ex-unicorn. "And this morning, when I needed you most, when I needed you to help me, what did you do? You threw me into prison! You ripped out my heart and stepped on it!" She backed off a bit, trotting over to the Changeling Queen. "Well, I guess it only proves that you should never trust your idols."

         "Well said, sister," the Queen said with a chuckle. She looked at the shell-shocked Celestia. "I really ought to thank you, Celestia. Your actions this morning have given me my greatest asset ever! You really shouldn't throw away your students so carelessly."

         Celestia was having trouble comprehending everything. A massive storm of guilt raged within her. Yet, there was something she had to know, something that bugged her. "Sister?" she asked. Mentally, the rapidly diminishing rational part of her face-hooved.

         Twilight smirked. "Yes, sister. As it turns out, I'm a royal-type Changeling. When Chrysalis found that out, she connected me to the Hive. As such, I'm just below her in rank, owing to her seniority. Still, the bond now labels us as sisters. It's how royal Changelings work."

         "I think that's enough explaning, Twilight," the Queen - Chrysalis - said. "I believe it's time we got to work. Once Celestia is ours, we can turn to the rest of Equestria."

         Celestia's eyes widened even more, and she finally found her resolve. Standing to her full height, she glared at both Changelings. "You will never take Equestria! Not so long as I live!" With that, she charged at Chrysalis, intent on skewering the Queen.

         Before she'd even made it halfway, she was flung back by a burst of magic from Twilight. "Your continued existence can be easily corrected, Princess," she spat.

         "Now, now, Twilight, don't rough her up too much," Chrysalis chided. "We need her alive, after all. The Equestrians would never accept us without her help."

         "You're a fool if you think I'd ever work for you," snapped Celestia.

         "We'll see about that," Twilight retorted. "Sister, I've been thinking: With her magic disabled, you don't need my help to corrupt her, do you?"

         Chrysalis arched an eyebrow. "I suppose not. What were you planning on doing?"

         Twilight's grin was downright evil. "I was planning..."
11533211112212111.title: Reap What You've Sown

choices: Twilight starts to change her mind
115332111122121111.content:
Continue
Things get worse in Canterlot.
Celestia stood there, helpless, she considered calling out her guards but this was her own battle and she knew that they wouldn't fare much better. She waited in horror to see what Twilight was going to do to her next.
Twilight, on the other hand, was obviously corrupted by evil from Chrysalis and not only that, it was powered by her own self-will. She was willing to take revenge on the princess and this was the perfect opportunity. However, she knew that after defeating Celestia that her friends would come and try to save her. They could never do this without her because there were six elements of harmony. However to attempt to eliminate the chance of a loop hole she decided upon bringing them to the scene for their defeat.
She said, "I was planning on bringing my old friends into the fold. I want nothing getting in our way to equality." Chrysalis knew what to do and commanded another changeling, disguised as a guard, to get that task done. Meanwhile they would keep Celestia in her place.
After a short while, the mane six came in to a shock. They all gasped to see the great Princess Celsetia thrown down her throne and sitting there helpless. Twilight wasted no time as she continued with her plan.
She said, "Well nice of you to join before your last days of freedom."
Applejack said, "What in tarnation is going on here?
Rarity said, "Twilight is that you?
Rainbowdash, Pinkiepie, and Fluttershy just stood there is the back still taking in everything that was happening.
Twilight responded, "What do you think. I didn't think that it would come to this but I am afraid that our friendship is over.
Rainbowdash didn't believe her and said, "Alright Twilight, we found you, but you can cut the act and tell us what is really going on." She smiled a short lived smile.
Twilight wasn't moved at all and said, "This isn't a joke. I am through with you, all of you! I want you to suffer what you put me through."
Pinkie pie stepped up and said, "What are talking about?"
Twilight responded, "I thought you would respond this way. Let me put it short, you all aren't my friends. You were just using me to be able to get to Celestia. I tried to tell you about the changelings but none of you believed me until it was almost too late. I had to work my but off to convince you all to believe me. On top of that, you just now did the same thing and got me put into prison. Now you all are going to pay." She snorts.
Fluttershy stepped up and said, " Twilight, we will never let you down on purpose. We were distracted by the wedding and all that glamour. You know that we never meant to hurt you.
Rainbowdash came up and said, "Yeah, you can't throw away our friendship for that, especially after all we went through.
This made Twilight angry
Applejack came in and said, "Look we know that you are hurt and I want to say that we are all very sorry.
Twilight responded, " A little late for that but I might consider accepting that when I am through with you all."
Rarity said, " Hold on. I know that we aren't perfect, neither are you but can you consider being more rational?
Twilight replied, "No, now can you all stop talking. You are only prolonging what's yet to come."
Fluttershy, in a last attempt to talk her out of it said, " Before you take revenge I would like to um give you a reason to not do so. Forgive us please, if for nothing else, do it for Spike, in fact do it for your brother. He is the one you truly care about.
Twilight looked at the other three and said, "What are your last words?" Then she started thinking about what her decision would really bring.
Pinkie pie said, " I should be the one apologizing. You apologized to me when you didn't believe me about the parasprite crisis. I am so sorry for ever doubting you."
Applejack said, " Yeah, um I may not be able to relate like that, but I just want to make things right. I am sorry Twi."
Rarity said, " Me too. Sorry Twilight."
Rainbowdash was the last to respond and said, " Yeah me three. Sorry there, I hope you can forgive us."

115332111122121111211.content:
As Twilight and her ex-friends sat in Celestia's chamber, it was quiet, yet only filled with the slight sobbing coming from Pinkie Pie herself. The Royal Guards surrounded Twilight as she struggled to break out of her captive bonds with only the eyes of her old friends to watch in despair as the pony they once known as Twilight. Rainbow Dash had stared at what was left of Twilight, not believing what had just happened. Fluttershy was comforting Pinkie Pie by wrapping her hooves around her in a hug to calm her down. Rarity and Applejack both looked at Twilight with tears in their eyes looking at the monster that was not meant to be.

The guards slowly backed away from Twilight so that her friends could speak to her and sort out what was going on once and for all, Applejack was the first one to walk up close to Twilight as she continued to struggle out of her cuffs.

"Twi..." Applejack gulped, she was evidently scared at what the Changlings had done to Twilight, just seeing her act helpless after trying to destroy the Princess was enough to make the earth pony sniffle. "Can we jus' talk?" Applejack continued before giving another pause, yet Twilight was not listening to what her enemy had to say. "We all jus' wanna talk to ya' nice and slow." Applejack kept her eyes fixed on Twilight, still trying to break from her bonds even though it was most likely that she wasn't able to.

Twilight stopped moving around and looked up at Applejack, filled to the brim with hate and disgust that she was still talking.

"Go away!" Twilight screamed, causing the guards to stay alert in case she was going to break out of her bonds.

"Why are ya' on th' bad side, Twi?" Applejack asked, ignoring Twilight's screams and yells. "They ain't no good, look what they did to ya'!" Applejack kept on going with her questions.

"I don't want to speak to you... I need to stay with my sister!" Twilight shouted, looking away from Applejack and the rest of her old friends.

"Th' Changling Queen ain't no sister!" Applejack argued back.

"My hive mind... I need to stay with the hive... I can't leave them alone..." Twilight grumbled, two sides in her fighting, she really wanted to hurt all of the ponies in the room, her anger was letting her take it too far and tears began to fall from her eyes. "You don't understand.. it's the pain... they're crying... I can feel it... they need me... my sister needs me..." Twilight shouted in between her sobbing, Applejack turned her head back to Rarity and Rainbow Dash who were as confused as she was at what Twilight was trying to say.

Rarity and Rainbow Dash took a few steps forward closer to Twilight and both stood besides Applejack to look down at what has become of Twilight Sparkle.

"Twilight please... you were never like this... we love you so much and care for you... the Changlings are controlling you, this isn't you!" Rarity spoke out, Twilight didn't want this talk either way, she wanted to escape and get back to her hive with her sister.

"I hate you... all of you... you left me to rot in the dungeons and I will never go back... Celestia lied to me... she lied to me... and I will take my revenge..."

Twilight and her escape
Twilight ran far from Canterlot. She slowed down because she was getting rather tired. When she felt like she made it to safety she stopped running and began walking. The Ever free forest wasn't too far away from where she was located and she smiled upon the thought of getting with Chrysalis.
She was paranoid with the fact that her friends may have followed her and could be attacked again at any moment. This made her feel nervous and constantly looking around for threats. She was protected by her changeling friends or guards she would call them now but she couldn't put her full trust in them. She walked further in the direction of the forest.
As she was walking, she heard some footsteps. She didn't stop to check out who or what was following her but she became even more nervous. Her changeling guards were not aware of anything. Their main focus was to get her to the queen. She heard some more footsteps.
This could no longer be ignored and she commanded one of her guards to go see if anything was following them. The guard flew away and she pushed on. This didn't change a thing and as far as she knew, the unknown was getting closer. She became uneasy with this feeling.
She became angry and finally stopped to check on things. There was nothing but silence as she looked around the area. She looked around some more and saw nothing. When she thought everything was clear she turned her head and saw a pony-like figure ahead.
She yelled, "Halt who goes there!"
This figure was unmoved by her words and approached her. Twilight yelled some more but it didn't change the figures actions. The figure got close and revealed itself as Luna.
Luna said, "What is the meaning of this! I know why you are here!"
Twilight wasn't scared and she said, "So you heard the news. What of it! I am on my own now."
Her old friends then came up behind the princess but they didn't say a word.
Twilight looked at them all in disgust and said, "Go away. You have no place here."
Her friends didn't back down. They were all too concerned with Twilight and her well being. Pinkie pie stepped up and said, "So this is our last goodbye?" She was still injured by Twilight's actions earlier.
Twilight just looked at them all. She was surprised that they didn't try to arrest her but she didn't want them there. She replied, "You leave me no choice. If you don't get out of my way, then I will make you!"
The others were not moved and Luna said, "Chrysalis has deceived you. If you continue your voyage, you will only find out that she will let you down as well.
Rainbowdash said, "Yeah she is probably just using you."
Twilight didn't listen and replied, "How could she? This was my choice."
Applejack replied, "Well that's true but think about it. She used Prince Charming without a doubt."
Twilight responded, "Well duh, if I didn't know that then this would have never happened. You already forgot the very reason why I am mad at you!"
Fluttershy stepped up and said, "Well we are just trying to get you to think. If Chrysalis used him to get her way, then she would have no problem trying to do the same to you."

115332111122121111211221.content:
"I would never trick or deceive my own Changlings." The Changling Queen walked out of a few trees, revealing herself to everyone in the forest. She walked over to her connected sister and stood right next to her in an attempt to protect her.

"You're going to use her and then lie in her face!" Rainbow Dash shouted out to the Changling Queen.

"Twilight is part of the Royal Changling blood line, there would be no possible way I would betray my own sister in the Hive mind." Chrysalis explained to the ponies on the other side of the path, she put her hoof on top of Twilight's mane and petted her like a small child.

"Slander!" Luna called out, pointing her hoof at the Changling Queen.

"Twilight... be a dear and show these creatures what you truly are." Chrysalis ordered her sister.

"With pleasure." Twilight grinned, her horn began to glow a bright green and slowly her entire pony body began to fade away to reveal her true Changling form in front of all of her old friends. Their mouths stood open as they watched the Twilight they once knew crumble away and turn into the monster that Chrysalis had created, Twilight's body had now changed into her Changling form and the differences from a normal Changling were most evident. She had a crown wrapped around her horn and jewelery had spawned all over her body to show importance and demonstration of high ranking to all.

"Oh ma' stars..." Applejack gasped, unable to believe the sight in front of her.

"We lost her..." Rainbow Dash shouted.

"This is not possible... Twilight cannot be a Changling of such importance..." Luna yelled.

"You see, I was not lying." Chrysalis began to laugh loudly in front of Twilight's old friends.

Twilight stared at her old friends, acknowledging their pity as they lost their so-called friend, Luna growled at the sight of Twilight's new form and she began to walk over to where Chrysalis and Twilight were standing.

"You shall not take Twilight away from us!" Luna yelled to the Changling Queen, she slowly trotted her way towards the Queen ready to give her a magical bolt full of electricity.

         Twilight paused, and stared at Celestia. "Really? You told her nothing of my supposed 'abduction'?"

         "It's more than that," Chrysalis said, looking carefully at the Princess of the Sun. "She hasn't told her anything about the Changelings at all."

         Twilight's grin reached new levels of evilness. "Oh, this is just too much!" Her form shifted, until she was wearing the form of the lavender unicorn that Celestia had once known. "Princess, I ought to thank you. You've made my job so much easier!" With a flash, she teleported away, leaving a cackling Chrysalis and a horror-struck Celestia.

*****


         In her tower, Princess Luna contemplated the scenery below her, though in truth her thoughts were elsewhere. Her sister had seemed anxious when she'd woken Luna up for her nightly duties. What could trouble Celestia so? What could - ?

         A knocking on the door interrupted her thoughts, along with a voice. "Princess Luna?"

         Luna recognized the voice, and smiled as she opened the door to her room. "Twilight Sparkle! We are pleased to see thee once again."

         Twilight smiled as she stepped inside. "It's good to see you, too, Princess Luna. We haven't really spoken since Nightmare Night."

         "Indeed, and that was quite some time ago," the midnight alicorn agreed. "But what brings thee to our chambers at this time?" She paused as a thought occured to her. "Might thou know what troubles our sister? She seemed quite anxious when we awoke to raise the moon."

         "I have an idea," Twilight replied. "But first, I have to ask: Did Celestia tell you anything about what happened yesterday, during the wedding?"

         Luna frowned. "Nay, she did not. We did not bother her overmuch, since she seemed tired."

         Twilight sighed. "Well, I think you should know what happened." With that, she told Luna everything, from her own suspicions about Cadence, to the revelation that Cadence had been imponynated by a Changeling, to the spell that had driven the Changelings out.

         When she was finished, Luna looked upset. "Why did she not tell us of this? Why did she see fit to hide this from us?"

         Twilight grimaced. "She... well, I guess she didn't want you to think she was weak. I didn't mention this before, but the Changeling Queen actually managed to overpower her."

         Luna gaped at Twilight. "Thou... thou art serious. Our sister was defeated?"

         Twilight nodded. "I'm guessing Celestia is trying to keep that knowledge under wraps. She doesn't want any political reprisals for seeming weak. Or..." She trailed off, and looked uncertainly at Luna. "Perhaps she was afraid that if you knew, you'd suffer a... relapse."

         Luna gasped. "Twilight Sparkle, how couldst thou think such a thing of us?! Our sister has been there for us ever since thou and thy friends released us from the grip of the Nightmare!"

         "And yet she didn't tell you of a major threat to Equestria's security," Twilight said. "Nor, it seems, of what happened this morning."

         Luna blinked. "What, pray tell, did happen this morning?"

         Twilight sucked in a breath. "When I woke up this morning..." Her form shimmered, lavender fur being replaced by black chitin, her horn becoming longer and jagged, and a second, crown-shaped growth appearing behind the first. "I woke up like this. As a Changeling."

         Luna's eyes widened, before a saddened look crossed her face. "Oh, Twilight Sparkle, how could this have happened to thee?" The Lunar Princess was already thinking of ways to try and reverse this baleful polymorphing her friend had undergone.

         "I honestly don't know," Twilight said. "My friends were the first to find me, and I was able to convince them of who I was. But..." She choked, a few tears coming to her eyes. "But Celestia didn't even give me a chance to defend myself! She took one look at me and threw me into the dungeon, convinced I wasn't the real Twilight!"

         Luna thought she couldn't suffer any more shocks tonight. She was wrong. "Thou... thou must be lying, Twilight Sparkle! Our sister would never imprison anypony without hearing them out!"

         "Do I look like I'm lying?!" Twilight replied through her tears. "She betrayed me! After everything I've done in her service, when I needed her the most, she turned her back on me! I was only able to escape because the warden fell asleep!" Twilight broke down sobbing.

         The sight tugged hard at Luna's heart. She could recall feeling the same for a time. When the Nightmare had first possessed her, she'd mentally cried out for her sister to set her free. Instead, Celestia had banished both her and the Nightmare to the moon for 1000 years. That had hurt. Yet... the sting of that couldn't possibly compare to what Twilight felt. Luna moved forward, and wrapped Twilight in a hug, holding her close. "Twilight Sparkle, we shall have a word with our sister about this. Mayhap we can convince her to rethink her position."

         Luna couldn't feel it, but Twilight felt the love Luna had for her fill her up. Through her sobs, buried in Luna's chest, she smiled. "But Celestia didn't trust you with knowing about the Changelings."

         Luna frowned. "Be that as it may - "

         Twilight interrupted. "And she didn't tell you that your first and best friend from Nightmare Night had 'gone missing'. She didn't consider your feelings at all!"

         Luna grimaced. "Twilight, what art thou saying?"

         Twilight looked up at Luna with a serious expression. "I'm saying Celestia doesn't trust you. Tell me, how many court functions have you attended since you returned? How many ponies have come to you, asking for advice?"

         Luna opened her mouth to retort... and closed it. Finally, she admitted, "None. To both questions."

         Twilight smiled sadly. "Despite your eagerness to atone, the stigma of the Nightmare hangs over you like a cloud. Nopony will ever trust you completely. Not even Celestia."

         Luna couldn't comprehend it. This was Celestia's own student, saying these things! What was she supposed to think?

understand but still being her own sister it hurt to be banished to moon, but…, still there was a reason.” Rambled luna, Twilight was grew tired of this

“As thou can see, I have my own band to block out magic but mine is far more powerful as it was meant to deal with the likes of Monster like discord.” Luna started walking towards the small changling. “I’m sorry I had to do this, but you leave me with very little choice” Twilight was pain and she was embarrassed being out smart by somepony with literary the brains of a 5 year old. “Now lets see celestia.” “No, she can wait can’t see, you have royal duties to attend to.”

“Ahh, right you are lets see that warden.” Luna said with grin, “NO, NO.” “Fine then to celestia it is.” Twilight started to think fast of something else, maybe if she took her to see the warden instead her and the follow Changlings that outnumbered her could over power her, but that seem unlikely as it still was a royal Changlings without her powers and two weak Changlings verses an adult size Alicorn. Twilight backed away from the Queen. "I... I won't serve you!" she cried. "I won't!" She turned tail and fled back down the corridor.

         A few Changelings buzzed their wings in readiness to pursue her, but stopped when the Queen raised a hoof. "Let her go. She'll learn for herself. This world that now knows of our existence will never accept her as she is. Run where she might, she will never find peace. Sooner or later, she'll return to us." She laughed cruelly. "She will."

*****


         Twilight didn't know how long she'd run. Nor did she realize where she was running. All that mattered was that she had to run, run from the terrible ideas that had taken root in her brain at the Queen's words. It's a lie! she thought. I'm not a Changeling! I'm a unicorn! My parents are Night Light and Twilight Velvet! My brother is Shining Armor, Captain of the Guard! I was foalsat by Princess Cadence! I live in Ponyville with my friends!

         Twilight's thoughts were interrupted as she tripped on something, sending her sprawling onto her back. She didn't bother to get up as her emotions continued to run wild. Confusion and anger were foremost among those emotions. However, as she lay staring at the star-filled sky, those both drained away into an all-encompassing sadness. She curled up into a ball and began to weep.

         "Why?" she choked out. "Why did everything go so wrong? None of my friends believed me when I said that the fake Cadence was evil. Even Princess Celestia didn't believe me. When I was proven right, the Princess was defeated. We got captured by the Changelings, and rescued by my brother and the real Cadence. And after all of that, I woke up the next morning as a Changeling, and the Princess imprisoned me. It's like everything's snowballed out of control." She continued to weep, blubbering unintelligible sentances to nopony. Eventually, she cried herself to sleep.

1153321111221221.content:
Twilight stirred awake the next morning. Her eyelids were hard to open as she awoke. Twilight has never felt to weak before in her life. She managed to get to her hooves, but she fell when making an attempt to stand. After about five attempts, Twilight stood up. Her legs shook while she walked. Her steps were shaky and slow. Her mouth felt dry, and out of the corner of her eye she saw a small stream. She slowly walked over to the edge of the stream, and ever so carefully bent down to drink from it. What she received instead was her falling onto the muddy side and her head splashed into the water.

It was a sad sight. Twilight was once a proud unicorn, most honored student of Princess Celestia and weilder of the Element of Magic. She had many friends and saved the day more than once. But now, Twilight seemed to be like a sickly and weak animal, trying to survive despite what they are unable to do. She wasn't a changeling, she was a unicorn. But her body thinks otherwise. Since she could feel that no pony loves her, her body has become very weak. She was barely to stand. If this continued, she could almost die. Twilight was able to move her head out of the water, already taking more than enough of a drink. Her breathing started to get heavy and she could tell that her vision was starting to blurry. Twilight only wants to see her friends and be accepted by them, not to be feared and hated. Twilight eventually passed out from the lack of energy.


Who finds her?

1153321111221222.content:
While Twilight was busy crying herself to sleep, things were grim back in Canterlot. The guard at the prison had informed Princess Celestia of the break-out, and security had been tightened. The rest of the Elements of Harmony, along with Spike, were forced to remain while investigations were underway. Currently, they were with Princess Celestia in the throne room.

         "Nopony has ever escaped from Canterlot's dungeons before," Celestia said, pacing back and forth in front of the throne. "That Changeling had to have gotten help."

         The Elements and Spike exchanged glances. "Yer Highness," began Applejack, "Ya didn't really give that Changeling much of a chance to defend herself."

         Celestia paused in her pacing, arching an eyebrow at the farmer. "You're saying I should give a known enemy of Equestria a chance to deceive me?"

         "You weren't there the whole time that we were, your Highness," Rarity explained. "This Changeling was nothing like the others, and she seemed... genuinely convinced that she was Twilight Sparkle."

         Celestia shook her head. "A ploy to gain sympathy. Nothing more."

         Spike frowned. "But that can't be right, Princess. She knew things. Things nopony but the real Twilight could have known. She knew exactly what Twilight said to me that night I ran away, after thinking that I'd been replaced as her favorite assistant. 'This is not the Spike I know and love!' There's no way a Changeling would have known that! The only ones there were me, Twilight, and Owloysius."

         Celestia frowned as well, trying to rationalize that. "Perhaps Twilight had already been replaced at that point. The Changelings may have been around longer than we thought."

         Rainbow Dash shook her head in disbelief. "Princess, I can tell you're just grasping at straws now. You're in denial of the truth. The truth is, you threw your own student in the dungeon when she needed you the most!" She glared at Celestia, who wore an expression of shock. "As the Element of Loyalty, that really rubs me the wrong way. If you can't own up to what you've done, then I'll just go find Twilight myself!"

         "Not alone, you won't!" Pinkie Pie said, bouncing in place. "I'm coming too! Twilight's going to need a party to cheer up when we find her!"

         "A-and she might need a bit of kindness from her friends..." Fluttershy agreed softly. Applejack and Rarity nodded. All five of them looked at the shell-shocked Princess.

         "Princess Celestia, we thank you for everything you've done for us in our lives," Rarity said, bowing. "But if you'll excuse us, we need to find our wayward friend. I suggest you look into how ponies can be changed into Changelings in the meantime." With that said, all five departed in haste, leaving the Princess behind.
1153321111221222.title: Revelations

choices: It's Braeburn! Seems she ran all the way to Appleloosa...
It's... Trixie? The showmare's changed since her visit to Ponyville...
11533211112212222.content:
Twilight stirred slowly as Celestia's sun broke the horizon. She slowly opened her eyes, the action requiring far more effort on her part than was normal. That worried her, but it was thrown by the wayside as she remembered everything that had happened. Yet the tears didn't come this time. In fact, Twilight felt an unusual dryness in her body. "I'm probably dehydrated. Great," she moaned. "That's all I need. I've faced down Nightmare Moon, an Ursa Minor, Discord, and the Changeling Queen, and I'm going to be done in by dehydration." She sighed. "Well, at least things can't get any worse."

         It was then that she realized that aside from the dryness, there was also a gnawing emptiness in her. It was similar to hunger, yet different at the same time. She was puzzled as to what it could mean. She didn't think about it too much longer, as her ears perked up. She could hear the sound of running water. "Well, I need to take care of that, first." She slowly struggled to her hooves, and was worried that it took her five attempts to stand up straight. "What the hay's wrong with me...?" she wondered. She slowly made her way to the water, and her worries increased as she felt the weakness in her body. She finally found the stream, and knelt down to take a drink.

         At least, that was the plan. Her legs buckled, and she ended up dunking her head in the water for a moment. Coughing, she managed to pull her head out. "Ugh... did not need to add 'drowning' to the list of ways I could potentially die out here," she choked out. After a moment, she carefully lowered her head, taking a nice, measured drink from the stream. When she was certain that her thirst had been quenched, she curled up next to the stream, pondering what was wrong with her. It was a few minutes later when her eyes widened in realization. "Of course! Changelings feed on love! And..." She trailed off. "And I ran from anypony who could have possibly given me any." She sighed. "So, I'm going to die of starvation."

         The weakness and fatigue of her body caught up to her, and she blacked out.

*****


         Unknown to Twilight, there was somepony nearby who was both unaware of what Changelings were, and was willing to lend a helping hoof to anypony in need.
11533211112212222.title: For Want of Love

choices: Twilight needs a bit more practice!
115332111122122222.content:
When Twilight awoke again, she was lying on a soft bed. "What?" She stammered. "Where am I?"

"You, my strange buglike friend, are in the presence of the great and powerful Trixie!" Somepony said to her. Twilight sat up, feeling oddly energized again. "Trixie? Is that really you?"

"Ah? You know of the great and powerful Trixie, do you?" Trixie smirked.

"I do, you were in Ponyville last year." Twilight said, recalling the events like they had happened yesterday.

"Yes, Ponyville. Not one of my greatest moments." Trixie admitted. "After that, Trixie went legit! She now performs proper magic shows, not just smoke and mirrors!"

"That's good to hear." Twilight said. "But why did you help me?"

"Trixie could not stand to leave any poor creature to die by the side of the road." Trixie said. "So she helped you into her trailer. If Trixie may ask, what are you?"

"Would you believe me if I told you that I used to be a Unicorn?" Twilight asked.

"Not really." Trixie said. "But Trixie has seen stranger things before. What are you now then?"

"A changeling." Twilight spat. "A creature that feeds off of love and emotion."

"Trixie is intrigued."

"When you helped me, you gave me love, I think." Twilight said, recalling her suddenly full feeling stomach. Her sensation of dehydration was gone as well.

"A stranger is a friend you haven't met, after all." Trixie said with a grin. "What is your name?"

"My name's Twilight Sparkle." Twilight said.

Trixie's eyes shot open. "You? You were the one that vanquished that Ursa!"

"Yes." Twilight said sheepishly.

"Well then, Trixie considers us even then." Trixie said. "You pulled Trixie's bum out of the fire back then, she saved you today."

"And I'm very grateful." Twilight said. "But I need to find some way to find love to feed on, while I investigate what changed me."

Trixie smirked. "Then Trixie has just the thing for you."

"Huh?"

"Trixie knows of ways to earn the love and approval of thousands of ponies!" Trixie said. "You can star in Trixie's next show!"

"What?"

"The crowds will love you!" Trixie explained. "If you pull of magic like you did that night, you will surely catch the eye of the audience, thus fueling your need for love!"

"That... that's a great idea!" Twilight was amazed at the idea. This way she wouldn't have to steal love or impersonate somepony.

"Then it's settled, Trixie shall teach you all there is to know about the business and tomorrow, you will star as her assistant!" Trixie said with glee.

The two of them shook hooves on it.

"We shall now begin our rehearsal." Trixie said.
115332111122122222.title: It's... Trixie? The showmare's changed ...

choices: Twilight can change into almost anything! Within reason, of course... no Ursas
Twilight can only shapeshift into ponies
1153321111221222221.content:
It pays to be a quick study, Twilight thought to herself giddily. She had been rehearsing with Trixie for less than an hour, and the showmare was gushing about her performance. Twilight blushed, still unused to being complimented for her magic. "Really, Trixie, I'm not that special."

         "But you are, Twilight!" Trixie exclaimed. "It took me weeks of practice to get as confident with my magic on stage as you have in less than an hour! You're a natural!"

         "Really, I'm just a quick study, that's all," Twilight demurred.

         The showmare shook her head. "Twilight, there's being a quick study, and then there's natural talent." She paused, and cocked her head. "When last we met, you mentioned that your special talent was magic, did you not?"

         "More like my friends blurted that out..." Twilight murmured, thoughts of her old friends bringing her mood down rapidly.

         Trixie noticed the ex-unicorn's declining mood. "Whatever is the matter?"

         Twilight considered lying, but after everything that had happened, she was in no condition to do so. So it was that Trixie found herself in the embrace of a distraught Changeling. "Oh, Trixie! I've had a terrible couple of days!" With that, everything came tumbling out; the fiasco at the rehearsal, crashing the wedding, the banishment of the Changelings, and waking up as one of Equestria's newest enemies. "...And the worst part is, Princess Celestia didn't believe it was me! She threw me into the dungeon like I was some kind of criminal!" Twilight continued to weep. "Me, her own student..."

         Trixie, while she hadn't expected the outpouring of emotion, had nonetheless listened intently. She stroked the ex-Unicorn's mane with a hoof as Twilight bared her soul. Still, that last bit of information caused her to blink. "Wait, you're the Princess's student?"

         "I was," Twilight choked out. "A-anyway, another Changeling found me, and broke me out of the dungeon. He led me to the Queen, who told me that it was possible that I'd always been a Changeling... feeding on the love of my parents, and later my friends, using that to maintain my 'disguise' of a normal unicorn."

         Trixie kept stroking the other's mane. "Twilight, let Trixie ask you: Is there anything in your memory to suggest that that is in any way true?"

         Twilight paused. "Well, no..."

         "And what, exactly, was the Princess's reaction when she saw you like this?"

         Twilight frowned, then her eyes widened. "She... she asked me, 'Where is she?' She thought I was a Changeling that took my own place!"

         Trixie smiled. "There, you see? Some wicked magic has befallen you, Twilight, and Trixie for one will help you to get through this."

         Twilight blinked. "But why would you help me? I thought you hated me, Trixie."

         Trixie's smiled gained a wan element, and she dropped her stage persona entirely. "I did, for a time. But after losing many of my personal belongings due indirectly to my own tall tales, I realized that I had let my ego get the better of me." She waved a hoof around them, indicating their current surroundings. "I spent a lot of time getting back on my feet. I had to call in some favors to get a new wagon. And I had time to think. I realized that blaming you for my own shortcomings would go nowhere, and that the next time I saw you, I would apologize." She grinned. "I never suspected my apology would entail saving your life."

         Twilight returned the grin. "Like you said, we're even, now." Suddenly, the world was briefly engulfed in a green light, causing both mares to blink rapidly. "What... just happened?" Twilight asked, when she could see again.

         Trixie looked dumbfounded. "L-look at yourself!"

         Twilight looked at her hoof, and gasped. Instead of the pock-marked black hooves she'd had before, her hoof was now whole, and a baby-blue color. The color was a dead ringer for the mare in front of her. "Mirror! I need a mirror!" Trixie obliged, magicking over a body-length mirror. Twilight stared at her reflection, which was a perfect copy of Trixie's.

         "Didn't you mention that Changelings could... well, change their forms?" Trixie asked, getting over her shock.

         "Yeah..." Twilight replied. "I was thinking about you..." She paused, then shifted her focus to a different image. The world flashed green again. When Twilight looked in the mirror this time, she nearly wept in relief. Her reflection was that of a lavender unicorn with a slate-blue mane with pink highlights. Her eyes were violet, and most importantly, her cutie mark was a magenta starburst with five white stars around it. "YES! I look like myself again!"

         Trixie grinned. "You know, this could work wonders for our routine together. If you could assume different forms, it could really make things wonderous! What else can you change into, Twilight?"

         Twilight paused to consider. "You know, there's only one way to find out." She shared a knowing look with the showmare. "Testing!"
1153321111221222221.title: Twilight Sparkle, Superstar

11533211112212222212.content:
Continue
Twilight and Trixie.
Trixie smiled, knowing that Twilight had abilities unlike any other pony. She knew of the changelings but never experienced one besides Twilight who wasn't technically a born changeling. She was excited to know what Twilight could do and how much she could improve her acts. She said, "Alright Twi, if it's okay for me to call you that, let us see what you can do.
Twilight answered, "Okay, I will try changeing into that rock." She tried changeing into a rock she saw but to no avail.
Trixie replied, "Well I guess you can only mimic other ponies. That's rather odd."
Twilight answered, " I guess so, well changelings have their limits too."
Trixie replied, "No matter. You could travel with me and perform. With our abilities we will have the best act in the world. What do you say?"
Twilight didn't think that she would have a new life from this one change but she did love Trixie. Trixie kept her alive, saved her life and was actually a great friend, she changed for the better. She replied, "Well sure I would love to travel with you."
Trixie was surprised and replied, "Are you sure? You would have to leave home and everything behind you. That might be for the rest of your life, do you want to go down that road?"
Twilight answered, "Yeah I would. If my friends want me then they can come looking and they will find me."
Trixie replied, "Well I am not going to stop you. Come on, I will take you to my place. We can prepare for a big show tomorrow."

1153321122.content:
"Are you alright, dear?" Rarity said behind the door. "Yeah, we heard ya screamin' like a banshee. Everything okay?" said another voice with a southern accent. "Yeah totally!" came another voice with a hint of tomboyism. Twilight was in quite a pickle now that her friends are at the door. "N-nothings wrong! I just had a...a bad dream and fell out of bed! Just fine!" she fibbed. "You sure? You sound kinda nervous." AJ said "I'm fine and okay. I'm really tired and exhausted by recent events with the wedding and all." Twilight responded. "Oh, alright. We were just making sure that you weren't in any trouble." replied Rarity. "It's fine! It's fine! I'll just go back to bed for a little while longer." "Just don't be late for breakfast!' she heard Pinkie shout.

Twilight thought she was off the hook until her new form betrayed her. Her new Changeling wings started to buzz loudly throughout the room. "What the hay was that?" said Rainbowdash. Oh shoot! Stupid wings! as Twilight cursed to herself as her wings buzzed louder. "What's going on in there, Twi?" "Uh...uh...just a bug! Nothing more! Heh heh..." was all she could say, hoping that they won't barge right in. "Sounds bigger than any other bug ah've heard." said AJ. "Yeah, what's going on Twilight?" said the RD. "It's just a bug okay! Can't you leave it alone!" she nervously proclaimed as the buzzing continued. "Twilight, you've been actin' funny real lately. You sure nothin's wrong, sugar-cube?" "How about letting us in?" spoke Rainbow Dash. Great now what! Twilight was running out of options until she mentally face-hooved. She was a Changeling so she could transform back into normal self! Though of course she never tried to use the magic Changelings ever used to so it would be a gamble if she messes up on the first try. She concentrated hard on being normal and being the violet unicorn she was born as. Her crooked horn glowed green along with the rest of her body as it flashed brightly in the room just before the door opened.
1153321122.title: Changing Face Fast

11533212.content:
Twilight groaned and tossed under her sheets as the sun shone brightly through the window and into her face. She thought she had closed them since last night.

With that, she jumped out of bed, stretched, and stifled a yawn like most people...er, ponies do after a night's rest. Though somehow something felt off and she felt slightly awkward, but didn't know why. She rubbed some sleep out of her eye and trotted into the bathroom. With her magic, she took a hand towel, damped it with sink water and washed her groggily and still tired face. After drying with another towel, her eyes widened as she saw something weird with her reflection, something out of place.
11533212.title: Nothing's different... yet.

choices: Practicality. "You're right, I'll tell the Princess immediately."
Pride. "She doesn't need to be worried about something like this."
115332121.content:
Twilight stared at the fangs that were visible over her lower lip. "What the hay?" she muttered, as she felt her teeth with her tongue. A moment later, she winced as she felt her tongue get cut slightly by one of the fangs in question. "Okay, I felt that, so this isn't a dream."

         Sighing, she went through her morning routine, though she remained worried about those fangs. When she opened the door to her main suite, she was unprepared to see Pinkie Pie there, with a look of triumph on her face. "HA! I told you girls, Twilight's become a vampony!"

         Twilight stared at Pinkie, then looked past her to see the rest of her friends, all wearing various degrees of shock. Then the lavender unicorn sighed. "Pinkie, I am NOT a vampony. How the hay did you think of something like that? Come to think of it, what are all of you doing in my room?"

         Rainbow Dash answered. "Pinkie just woke us up, claiming that one of us had been turned into a vampony, or something like that. I thought it was a load of horseapples, but those fangs are pretty obvious."

         Rolling her eyes, Twilight walked out, and stuck a hoof into the sunlight. When nothing happened for a few seconds, she pulled it away. "Well? Any other silly theories?"

         Pinkie looked stunned that she was wrong. "B-but, my Pinkie Sense told me one of my friends was a vampony! Itchy jaw, chattering teeth, and chilly neck all add up to that!"

         Twilight gave her a deadpan look. "And have you ever had that particular combo before?"

         Pinkie blinked, then sighed. "Well, no. I might have misread it." She perked up. "But it meant something was wrong, and I found it!"

         Twilight sighed. "Yes, these fangs are a bit worrisome, but there's no need to go flying off the handle. I'll just use a glamour on myself, and try to research what may have caused this in my library."

         Applejack sighed. "Twi, ya DO remember we're in Canterlot, right? That Princess Celestia is here 'n all? Ah'm pretty sure she'd be willin' ta shed some light on this subject."

         Twilight frowned. On the one hoof, it made sense. Being the Princess's student, she was obligated to inform her teacher if there was any potential danger to her welfare. On the other, there was a bit of personal pride Twilight had in not asking for her mentor's help for most problems. Would her practicality or her pride win in this instance?
